Your first print issue usually arrives in 4-8 weeks. Ship times can vary due to when your order is placed within the publication cycle. Please note that House Beautiful publishes 6 times a year,Feb/Mar, Apr/May, Jun/Jul, Aug/Sept, Oct/Nov, and Dec/Jan are combined issues and count as two issues as indicated on the issue's cover. The digital version of your magazine is available immediately in our app starting from the dates listed below. __ Issue Digital Version Available Jan/Feb 1/16 Mar/Apr 3/26 May/Jun 5/14 Jul/Aug 7/16 Sep/Oct 9/17 Nov/Dec 11/26 __ *Issue dates and frequency are subject to change at any time. What can I get for free? Even if you're not a House Beautiful All Access member, you can enjoy 3 HouseBeautiful.com articles a month at absolutely no cost. Why am I still blocked from reading some House Beautiful stories? You must be trying to read an exclusive story, or just hit the maximum free articles during your 30-day limit. If you are not already a member, you will need to join first. If you have already purchased a membership but have not yet created an account, visit our site and click "Sign Up" in the top right corner using the same email you used to purchase your membership and set a new password. If you have signed in before, simply log in. Once logged in, you will gain access to all member content and benefits! *Remember to log in on every device that you use. What is the difference between  All Access and Digital Only Options? Both plans give you complete access to HouseBeautiful.com , exclusive stories, and a members-only newsletter. If you're looking for more, Unlimited gives you a print subscription, special invites to events, and exclusive connections to designers and other experts. If I already subscribe to House Beautiful print magazine, do I still need to pay for a membership to get unlimited access? Thanks for being a subscriber! Yes, the new House Beautiful membership is a separate offering from the print magazine and requires a separate subscription. Feel free to sign up here for the annual option, which includes another year of the print magazine. If I signed up for a membership, how do I access the current digital issue and archived issues? Go to the App Store or Google Play Newsstand on your device. Search for the House Beautiful Magazine app within the store or newsstand. Download the app on your device and launch it. Tap the “Subscribe” icon in the app and under “Existing Subscribers” enter your email & zip to log in. Can I only subscribe to the print magazine? Absolutely. Head here . But if you want the full House Beautiful experience—exclusive access to bonus content, the members-only newsletter, unlimited stories on HouseBeautiful.com —you need to sign up for the membership program. Where can I read all of the exclusive member stories? If you're already a member, browse here . If you aren't, j oin now ! Is House Beautiful All Access available to international subscribers? The annual options are available to both U.S. and Canada residents only, and anyone with a U.S.-currency based card (AMEX, Visa, Mastercard, Discover, PayPal, Amazon Pay) can subscribe to the monthly digital-only option. Where can I contact customer service if I have issues with my account? You can reach a customer service rep with any questions h ere . We have a team ready to resolve any technical issues or assist in helping you upgrade or cancel your membership. Want More House Beautiful? Get interior design inspo, organization tips, easy DIYs, and everything in between right to your inbox. Since joining the House Beautiful team in 2023, Janae regularly creates seasonal gift guides in addition to reviewing and evaluating home decor, bespoke furniture, and accessories. Janae also routinely tests viral products, from luxury sheets to high-tech air purifiers , determining quality and guiding readers to the best purchases possible. Janae holds both a bachelor’s and master’s degree in journalism from the University of Missouri and began her career at Food Network shortly after graduation. She also covers relevant shopping deals and celebrity news in the home space, a skill she honed during her tenure as a news writer at Glamour . When she’s not writing or scoping out the next mattress to test, you can find her hunting for trinkets to add to her bookshelf or artfully arranging her Playbill collection. URL: https://www.housebeautiful.com/shopping/furniture/g26043224/best-nightstands/

The Best Nightstands of 2023 - Unique Nightstands Search Subscribe Design Inspiration Room Ideas How to Renovate Lifestyle Entertaining Shopping Guides All News All Videos Newsletter Follow About Us Promotions Other Editions Your Privacy Choices Privacy Notice Terms Of Use Skip to Content Decorate Rooms Gardening Shopping Lifestyle Subscribe sign in Search Prime Day Vacuum Deals Best Amazon Pillow Sales Prime Day Furniture Deals Designer Prime Day Picks 90 Pumpkin Carving Ideas Shopping Furniture 15 Best Nightstands to Make Your Bedroom Even Dreamier 15 Best Nightstands to Make Your Bedroom Even Dreamier Every bed deserves a bedside table! By Jessica Cherner Published: Sep 16, 2022 6:24 PM EDT Save Article West Elm Every item on this page was hand-picked by a House Beautiful editor. We may earn commission on some of the items you choose to buy. To anyone who argues that bedside tables aren’t essential bedroom furniture , not only do we beg to differ, but we’ve rounded up a list of the best nightstands to convince you otherwise. We don’t want to be dramatic, but there's nothing worse than waking up in the middle of the night with a parched throat and realizing that you have to actually stand up and walk to the kitchen to quench your thirst. Ideally, there’s a full glass within arm’s reach. Enter: nightstands. The thing about these clever furniture pieces is that they don’t necessarily have to be a nightstand to get the job done. You can opt for a dresser , end table, or even an ottoman depending on how low-profile your bed is. All a nightstand needs in order to serve its purpose is a flat surface for your phone, an accessory, and, of course, a glass of water. Like any piece of furniture , a nightstand can run in the thousands, but it can also cost less than $100 without skimping on style. Think a black oak, open-shelf bedside table for just $34 or a sleek, white hutch with its own charging station for $99. Best Overall CREATIVELAND Bedside End Table Read more Most Versatile West Elm Fluted Nightstand Read more Most Stylish Sand & Stable Nador Drawer Nightstand Read more All in all, a nightstand is a must. And since they aren’t exactly niche, there are loads to choose from. Scroll on, shop our must-have list for the easiest bedroom transformation ever. We guarantee adding a couple of these end tables will make a life-changing difference ! Best Overall CREATIVELAND Bedside End Table Now 23% Off $99 at Amazon Credit: CREATIVELAND Pros Compact Has a drawer Affordable Cons Requires assembly Not only does this nightstand have plenty of shelf space for displaying all of your books and a drawer for hiding items that aren't aesthetically pleasing, it also boasts rattan detailing for a natural look. Dimensions 18.9" H x 15.75" W x 15.75" D Materials Wood and rattan Assembly Yes Most Versatile West Elm Fluted Nightstand $189 at West Elm Credit: West Elm Pros Affordable Available in multiple sizes Available in multiple colors Cons Heavy This is my personal nightstand and I designed my whole bedroom around it. It’s simultaneously classic and a statement piece. The fluted nightstand is available in two sizes and four colors, all of which are earthy and rich. I have the white one, a bright matte shade that instantly brightens up my space. Dimensions 17.7" H x 13" D and 20.5" H x 16" D Materials Earthenware Assembly No Advertisement - Continue Reading Below Most Stylish Sand & Stable Nador Drawer Nightstand Now 16% Off $200 at Wayfair Credit: Wayfair Pros Compact Includes storage Cons Untreated wood Cane, which is just woven rattan , swept through the United States during most of the 70s, but it’s made a big comeback in recent years. Traditionally reserved for outdoor furniture , cane is finally making its way inside, giving us a good excuse to snatch all of the beachy finds we can. Dimensions 24.4” H x 18” W x 15” D Materials Wood Assembly Minimal assembly required Most Innovative ADORNEVE Nightstand with Charging Station Now 30% Off $70 at Amazon Credit: Amazon Pros Comes with charging station Affordable Cons Must be plugged into outlet For those whose phone chargers are just out of reach, rejoice. There's a nightstand with a charging station so that you never need to get out of bed to peep your text messages in the middle of the night. It’s made even more practical with three drawers. Dimensions 26.8" H x 13.8" W x 17.7" D Materials Shaving board Assembly Yes Advertisement - Continue Reading Below Most Charming Anthropologie Zagora Tasseled Nightstand $498 at Anthropologie Credit: Anthropologie Pros Hand-carved Lacquered for easy cleaning Cons Expensive When it comes to furniture, Anthropologie never lets us down . We’re loving the Zagora tasseled nightstand, which is handcrafted with beveled edges and sealed in lacquer so that you don’t have to be too precious with it. That said, you may still want to use a coaster. Dimensions 28" H x 26" W x 17.5" D Materials Tropical hardwood and brass Assembly No Most Low Maintenance Crate & Barrel Batten White Oak Floating Nightstand $249 at Crate & Barrel Credit: Crate & Barrel Pros Minimal Stackable Cons On backorder At first glance, this white oak design may look more like a shoe box than a nightstand, but picture it mounted to your wall beside your bed. Floating shelves like this one work best in small spaces with little floor space to spare. And unlike traditional nightstands, you can horizontally stack these for extra storage. Dimensions 8.5" H x 23.54" W x 11.73" D Materials Poplar, hardwood and oak Assembly Yes Advertisement - Continue Reading Below Most Affordable Mainstays Classic Open Shelf Nightstand Now 13% Off $34 at Walmart Credit: Walmart Pros Under $40 Available in multiple colors Cons No hidden storage Because all of your wares are on full display, we’d suggest opting for an open-shelf nightstand only if you’re a minimalist or highly organized. This simple option, available in six finishes, is on sale for just $34. Dimensions 20.3" H x 15.7" W x 15.7" D Materials Wood Assembly Yes Most Coastal Serena & Lily Driftway Nightstand $1,298 at Serena and Lily Credit: Serena & Lily Pros Lacquered for easy cleaning Available in multiple colors Cons Expensive Hand-wrapped in linen, the Parsons-style nightstand from Serena & Lily is more luxe than any traditional nightstand needs to be, but we’re here for it. If we lost you at “ linen ,” a traditionally delicate fabric, let us win you back. It’s been treated with five coats of matte lacquer, so it’s not quite as delicate as it may look. Dimensions 24” H x 22” W x 18” D Materials Linen, brass, and wood Assembly No Advertisement - Continue Reading Below Best for Small Spaces Pottery Barn Garrett Flip Top C-Table Nightstand $499 at Pottery Barn Credit: Pottery Barn Pros Expandable Compact Cons Small Ideal for small spaces , this folding night table is as sleek and as modern as design gets. Simply slide the muted brass base under your bed and bring the onyx top, which flips open and nearly triples in size, as close to you as you want. We’re suckers for clever and innovative furniture, and this piece from Pottery Barn is at the top of our list. Dimensions 31"  H x 34" W x 13" D Materials Onyx and brass Assembly No Best Design Throwback Opalhouse Woven Drawer Nightstand $30 at Target Credit: Target Pros Ships within three business days Ideal for small spaces Cons Low-profile Another chic rattan find, this low-profile , two-drawer gem is the brainchild of Opalhouse and Jungalow, which is arguably one of the best collabs we’ve seen. Clever details, including the curved handles and tiered legs, are a not-so-subtle not to the bohemian-style furniture of the 60s , making this nightstand one of our favorites. Dimensions 22”  H x 20” W x 18” D Materials Wood Assembly No Advertisement - Continue Reading Below Most Iconic Middlebrook Designs Mid Century Nightstand $159 at Overstock Credit: Overstock Pros Available in multiple finishes Versatile Affordable Cons Veneer prone to blemishes Reminiscent of Vittorio Dassi’s 50s design but a mere fraction of the price, we can't help obsessing over this $160 alternative. Aside from price, the downside to the original was that the Italian furniture maker made his iconic nightstands in only one kind of wood, whereas the affordable dupe is available in five finishes, including both black and white. Dimensions 24" H x 20" W x 14” D Materials Pine Assembly Yes Best Space-Saver Urban Outfitters Zion Acrylic Side Table $199 at Urban Outfitters Credit: Urban Outfitters Pros Easy to move Versatile Cons Scratches easily Our go-to hack for saving space is swapping out opaque furniture with something acrylic. It may not literally save space, but acrylic furniture gives the illusion of space since it's completely transparent. See-through furniture (like this minimalist nightstand) is definitely the easiest way to fake a bigger bedroom. Dimensions 14” H x 14” W x 14” D Materials Acrylic Assembly No Advertisement - Continue Reading Below Best Floating Woodendot Alba L Bedside Table $324 at 1stDibs Credit: 1stDibs Pros Hidden storage Hand-made Cons Ships from Europe You already know we love a floating shelf —especially one with hidden storage and a modern design. The Alba bedside table has both. Mount it to your wall and hide your favorite guilty pleasure page turner behind the taller of the two wood ovals. No matter the look of your space, the Alba will instantly elevate it. Dimensions 24.41” H x 21.66” W x 16.15” D Materials Plywood Assembly No Most Unique Yet Design Studio Tombul Nightstand $679 at revivalrugs.com Credit: Revival Rugs Pros Lacquered for easy cleaning Customizable Cons Expensive Revival Rugs is famous for its collection of eye-catching floor coverings, but did you know that it also sells a handful of funky furniture? We’ve got our eye on the low-profile Yet Design Studio nightstand, a whimsically curved piece glazed in a silk matte lacquer. What’s more, you can customize it to your exact specifications! Dimensions 19.7” H x 17.7” W x 21.7” D Assembly No Materials Raw MDF and silk matte lacquer Advertisement - Continue Reading Below Most Simple FUFU & GAGA Furniture Two-Drawer White Nightstands $91 at Home Depot Credit: The Home Depot Pros Affordable Versatile Hidden storage Cons Stains easily We’ve all heard the saying, “the simplest solution is often the correct one,” and such is definitely the case when it comes to this charming two-drawer nightstand. If you’re in a bind and can’t pick a style, you really can’t go wrong with a classic silhouette. The open shelf doesn’t hurt either. Dimensions 26.1” H x 19.6” W x 15.7” D Materials Wood Assembly Yes What are the different types of nightstands? House Beautiful The great thing about a nightstand is that it can also be an end table . There are no rules (or specific types) of nightstands for it to serve its purpose as a place to put your phone while you sleep. Advertisement - Continue Reading Below How tall should a nightstand be? A nightstand should be the same height as your bed . That said, if it's slightly taller or shorter, that's okay. If it's more than several inches taller, you'll be reaching too high for your things. Why trust us? Jessica Cherner is House Beautiful 's Associate Shopping Editor and even though she lives in New York City, where space is limited, she scoured the Internet for two perfect nightstands, and is happy to share her research. Katelyn has more than a decade of experience as a writer, editor, and content strategist. In her previous role, she led the strategy for 25+ Hearst brands in the U.S. and globally across Facebook, Instagram, TikTok, Pinterest, and Twitter for five years. She holds a bachelor's degree in journalism from the University of Missouri and began her career writing news and commerce content for Country Living , Woman's Day , Good Housekeeping , and more. URL: https://www.housebeautiful.com/shopping/furniture/a45146525/saatva-rx-mattress-review/

Saatva Rx Mattress Review 2024: It's the Best Thing for Back Pain Search Subscribe Design Inspiration Room Ideas How to Renovate Lifestyle Entertaining Shopping Guides All News All Videos Newsletter Follow About Us Promotions Other Editions Your Privacy Choices Privacy Notice Terms Of Use Skip to Content Decorate Rooms Gardening Shopping Lifestyle Subscribe sign in Search Prime Day Vacuum Deals Best Amazon Pillow Sales Prime Day Furniture Deals Designer Prime Day Picks 90 Pumpkin Carving Ideas Soumi Sarkar Shopping Furniture I've Slept on Saatva's Rx Mattress for One Year and Can Confirm It's the Best Thing for Back Pain I've Slept on Saatva's Rx Mattress for One Year and Can Confirm It's the Best Thing for Back Pain You'll want to run (if you can) to buy this bed. By Katelyn Lunders Published: Jul 27, 2024 Save Article Every item on this page was hand-picked by a House Beautiful editor. We may earn commission on some of the items you choose to buy. Jump to: Delivery and Install Saatva Rx Performance Review Saatva Rx Pricing and Sizing Pros and Cons How the Saatva Rx Has Held Up Over Time My Final Verdict Saatva Rx Mattress FAQs Buying my first mattress was a core memory. Like many, I had spent the early years of my life sleeping on mattresses others had given to me: my parents, my university, or former tenants who didn't want to schlep their mattress to their next apartment. So when it was finally time to fork up my own cash to buy a new mattress, I went with an affordable, Live Better Award-winning option from Zinus . I was super happy with my purchase for years until I suffered from a running injury in 2022. I developed sciatica and found myself struggling to sleep on my once beloved bed-in-a-box mattress. I began seeing a chiropractor for treatment, and he recommended Saatva's Classic Mattress to help alleviate my pain. I was familiar with the brand as it's tested and approved by our editors , but like my first foray into mattress buying, the prices were still a bit jarring. I let the mattress sit in my cart for weeks while trying to convince myself I didn't really need it, but life has its way of surprising you beyond your wildest dreams. Saatva  Rx Mattress Now 15% Off $2,801 at Saatva About a month after my chiropractor suggested Saatva, I started a new job as Deputy Digital Editor at House Beautiful and was asked to review the Saatva Rx : The brand's first mattress "designed for sleepers with chronic back and joint conditions." (You really can't make this stuff up.) And despite my former hesitation to splurge on a high-quality mattress, now that I've slept on the Rx for a year, I can confidently say you can't put a price on pain relief. Delivery and Install Unlike many internet brands, Saatva mattresses are proudly "never stuffed in a box." They are made to order, and the brand offers a free white glove delivery service . The team reached out via email a few days before the delivery date to provide a four-hour window and gave me a heads-up call 15 minutes ahead of arrival. Despite having a difficult space to navigate, the two-man delivery team worked swiftly to remove my Zinus mattress and replace it with the new Rx. The entire installation process took less than 10 minutes. Related Story Everything You Need to Know About Nolah Mattresses Saatva Rx Performance Review The 15-inch Rx mattress has seven layers and is plush but very supportive . The top layer is made with hypoallergenic cotton and treated with Saatva's exclusive Guardin™ botanical antimicrobial treatment to keep your mattress mold-free—a standard across all of the brand's models. But what separates the Rx is its extra layers of pressure-relieving support. The Patented Lumbar Zone® Quilting, which offers more support in the center third of the mattress, helps to align your spine while you sleep. This feature works in tandem with the layer of gel-infused memory foam to support your lower back while you're sleeping. There is also a second high-density foam layer and a layer of 1,628 flexible, 1-inch micro-coils (in the Queen model) to cradle your body and relieve pressure points. All of this is stacked on top of the "groundbreaking" Therapeutic Support Core, which is made up of foam-wrapped coils that eliminate motion transfer, provide edge support, and offer pressure relief. Katelyn Lunders Firmness The Rx claims to be "best suited for side sleepers, but also great for back and combination sleepers who suffer from chronic back & joint conditions." As a combination sleeper with sciatica, I have found it very supportive, whether I sleep on my back or side. Thanks to the varied layers and materials, the firmness isn't one note like my former memory foam mattress. Each section of the Saatva Rx is catered to support a different part of your body, resulting in the feeling of being cradled, which I love. Edge Support I currently sleep alone, so I get to sleep smack dab in the middle of my Saatva Rx, but when I have shared the bed I experienced no issues with the edge support. Unlike some mattresses that will kind of roll you off as you attempt to get out of bed in the morning, the Saatva Rx holds steady. This is thanks to firm spring coils around the mattress's perimeter.  The coils provide support without sacrificing comfort due to the layer of foam on top of them. Motion Isolation The only motion in my bed most nights is my Chiweenie, and at 9 pounds, he isn't necessarily the best judge of the motion impact from shifting weight. That being said, I'm very impressed with the isolation, especially for a non-memory foam mattress. Despite the springs/coils, it holds very steady. Temperature Regulation I personally haven't experienced overheating from sleeping on the Saatva Rx, even in summer months, but it's worth noting that this mattress is not designed specifically for hot sleepers. The Saatva Rx does have cooling features, but if you're prone to night sweats, you might need to invest in a cooling mattress cover . Related Story The Top 20 Editor-Approved Luxury Sheets Saatva Rx Pricing and Sizing Although it's not the most expensive mattress on the market by a long shot, the Saatva Rx is an investment, but definitely one worth making if you suffer from chronic back and joint pain. The queen-sized mattress I tested retails for $3,295. However, Saatva constantly offers major deals, and if you only suffer from minor aches and pains, the Saatva Classic is a more affordable luxury alternative at $1,995. Plus, Saatva offers financing with Affirm at zero percent APR. Soumi Sarkar Pros and Cons Saatva Rx Mattress Now 15% Off $2,795 at Saatva Pros The firmness is just right. I've never felt more comfortable and supported while sleeping. I feel an improvement in my hip and lower back pain thanks to Saatva's body contouring and lumbar support. The white glove delivery is free and seamless. Saatva has a 365-day mattress trial! You can take a year to make sure the Rx is the right fit for you. Cons It's on the pricier side, but Saatva is known for its incredible deals! It's very unlikely you'll pay full price for your mattress. At 15 inches tall, the Rx sits higher than my former 12-inch mattress, so I had to purchase a new, king-sized duvet cover and insert to fully cover the queen-sized mattress. How the Saatva Rx Has Held Up Over Time I'm very happy to report that after one year of sleeping on the Saatva Rx, its performance is as strong as ever. I credit this to the mattress's luxury features, specifically the pocketed coils that provide sturdy support and prevent sagging over time. I recently took a two-week trip and felt the difference in my alignment from sleeping on another mattress. Once I returned to my Saatva Rx, I was sleeping soundly again, thanks to the many layers created for support and pain relief. The mattress is also still in mint condition after a year of sleeping on it with my dog, Oakley. I swear by this mattress protector , which saved my Saatva from ruin when he had a little accident a few months ago. My Final Verdict Saatva I will not claim this mattress cured my sciatica. (If only it were that simple!) But from the first night I slept on the Rx, my sleep life has improved drastically. Every fancy, patented feature that Saatva touts really does cradle your body into proper alignment. My hips often feel achy from sitting in meetings all day, and my previous mattress was offering no reprieve. Now, I actually find myself daydreaming about the sweet relief I know I'll feel at bedtime, and I wake up feeling well-rested and pain-free. The Rx has an incredible warranty , so I don't plan on purchasing another mattress in this lifetime, but I can now confidently say I would . So, if , like me, you've been suffering from chronic pain but are hesitant to shell out the cash for a luxury mattress, take this as your sign to splurge. Related Story These Luxury Mattresses Are Worth the Investment Saatva Rx Mattress FAQs How is the Saatva Rx delivered? Saatva offers free white glove delivery and also removes your old mattress free of charge. The process was seamless and much better than waiting for a bed-in-the-box mattress to inflate. Is the Saatva Rx compatible with an adjustable base? Yes, according to their site, the "Saatva Rx is compatible with most foundations, box springs, platform beds, and adjustable bases." It fit perfectly with my Zinus bed frame. Does the Saatva Rx come with a sleep trial? Yes, Saatva offers a 365-night home trial. If you opt to return or replace your mattress, you will need to pay a $99 pickup fee. Does the Saatva Rx come with a warranty? Saatva mattresses have a lifetime warranty. For the first two years, they will replace your mattress free of charge. Once you hit year three, they will repair and/or recover your mattress for a $149 fee. Core™ 1 Rx Foam Module Expand/Collapse 2" foam modules encased on top of each individual coil virtually eliminates motion transfer for more undisturbed sleep. Our proprietary foam is infused with graphite and phase-change material to help regulate body temperature, keeping you cool and comfortable all night. 2 8" Comfort Coil Unit Expand/Collapse Triple-tempered recycled steel springs work in tandem with the foam modules above to provide maximum contouring and pressure relief for sleepers with serious chronic back & joint issues. 3 Quantum-Edge Coils Expand/Collapse Firmer caliper spring coils around the perimeter of the mattress offer excellent edge support for better mobility while getting in and out of bed. Discover other great options The Saatva Classic Mattress star star star star star 3569 Reviews Saatva Classic Mattress $1,395 - $2,990 The Saatva HD Mattress star star star star star 144 Reviews Saatva HD Mattress $1,995 - $4,390 The Saatva Latex Hybrid Mattress star star star star star 250 Reviews Saatva Latex Hybrid Mattress $1,595 - $3,390 slide page 1 of 3 The Saatva Classic Mattress star star star star star 3569 Reviews Saatva Classic Mattress $1,395 - $2,990 The Saatva HD Mattress star star star star star 144 Reviews Saatva HD Mattress $1,995 - $4,390 The Saatva Latex Hybrid Mattress star star star star star 250 Reviews Saatva Latex Hybrid Mattress $1,595 - $3,390 slide page 1 of 1 Specifications FAQs Frequently asked questions Dimensions Expand/Collapse Saatva Rx is 15" high and comes in the following standard mattress sizes: TWIN: 38" x 75" TWIN XL: 38" x 80" FULL: 54" x 75" QUEEN: 60" x 80" KING/SPLIT*: 76" x 80" CAL KING: 72" x 84" * Split King consists of two separate Twin XLs Mattress weights & weight limit Expand/Collapse Mattress weight: TWIN: 70 lbs. TWIN XL: 76 lbs. FULL: 99 lbs. QUEEN: 124 lbs. KING/CAL KING: 151 lbs. SPLIT KING: 152 lbs./76 lbs. each Mattress weight limit: Up to 300 lbs. per sleeper Crafted in the U.S.A. Expand/Collapse Every Saatva mattress is crafted when you order it. We assemble all our mattresses in America with care and pride, using only the highest quality, globally sourced materials. We could have settled on cheaper materials and produced our mattresses elsewhere for higher profits, but we've never wavered in our commitment to quality. We believe it's the right thing to do for our customers, our American workers, and our economy. Eco-friendly materials Expand/Collapse Every Saatva Rx mattress features: • Cover made with organic cotton. • Guardin™ botanical antimicrobial treatment • Eco-friendly foams that are CertiPUR-US®* certified to meet their rigorous standards for emissions, content and durability • Recycled steel coils • Flame retardant barrier made from natural thistle pulp without toxic chemical sprays or fiberglass • Base panels on our single-sided mattresses are made with REPREVE® recycled polyester which removes four single-use plastic bottles from the waste stream with every Queen mattress made *CertiPUR-US® is a registered trademark of the Alliance for Flexible Polyurethane Foam, Inc. Delivery & setup Expand/Collapse Sit back and relax while we do all the work. Our free white glove delivery includes in-room delivery and set up. We'll even take away your old mattress at no additional cost to you. Just select free mattress removal at checkout. 365-night home trial Expand/Collapse At Saatva, we never pressure you to make up your mind quickly. All of our mattresses come with a 365-night home trial, so you have plenty of time to decide whether it’s right for you. If at any point during your home trial you’re not satisfied, just give us a call and we’ll come pick up the mattress and refund your money, less a $99 processing fee to cover our cost of gas and labor for the pickup. That’s it. + What makes the Saatva RX a good fit for people with chronic back pain? Expand/Collapse Saatva Rx is the first mattress on the market specifically designed to help sleepers dealing with serious & chronic joint and back conditions*. Its unique construction was designed to support, cradle, and contour to the body like no other mattress, which may help alleviate the daily aches & discomfort associated with these chronic conditions. *Please note that products and claims on this site and any Company linked sites have not been evaluated by any official institution and are not meant to diagnose, prevent, treat, or cure any illness or disease nor do we promise or guarantee that it will give you relief from any injury or ailment. Can a mattress alleviate joint pain? Expand/Collapse Yes. Mattresses that contour and conform to the body’s curves help relieve pressure points, which helps improve circulation and alleviate joint pain. Saatva Rx is designed with multiple layers of body-contouring foams, including our proprietary Rx foam modules which relieve pressure points unlike any other type of mattress. What is the Therapeutic Support Core™ in Saatva Rx? Expand/Collapse Saatva Rx features a new & groundbreaking coil core system called the Therapeutic Support Core™. It's made up of our proprietary Rx Foam Module™ encased on top of individually pocketed coils. The result is a mattress that automatically adjusts and contours to every curve and movement better than any single-layer foam. This virtually eliminates pressure points in problem areas to allow for therapeutic relief and more restorative sleep. Do Saatva mattresses contain fiberglass or a fiberglass sock? Expand/Collapse No. We never use fiberglass or toxic chemical flame retardants/barriers in any of our mattresses. Instead, we use either plant-based flame barriers, a Paladin flame barrier made with a blend of poly & rayon fibers, or organic New Zealand wool in our mattresses to meet federal safety standards. What flame retardants do Saatva mattresses use? Expand/Collapse The following Saatva mattresses use a natural, plant-based thistle flame retardant made of wood pulp bonded with a small amount of polyester: • Saatva Classic • Saatva HD • Saatva Youth • Memory Foam Hybrid (also contains natural wool as a flame retardant) The following Saatva mattresses use 100% GOTS certified organic New Zealand wool as a natural flame retardant: • Zenhaven Latex • Saatva Latex Hybrid • Crib Mattress Solaire adjustable firmness mattress uses Paladin, which is composed of flame retardant rayon fibers blended with polyester fibers. Contour5 memory foam mattress is covered on all six sides with a GREENGUARD®* Gold Certified natural flame barrier made of nontoxic cellulose fibers derived from tree byproducts. Bunk & Trundle mattress uses a nontoxic natural thistle & wool blend flame barrier. We do not use any harmful chemicals or sprays in any of our mattresses. Do I need to flip over or rotate my mattress regularly? Expand/Collapse Our Zenhaven, Latex Hybrid, Saatva HD, and Solaire mattresses do not need to be rotated from head to foot. This is due to the 5-zone alignment of the latex layer in those mattresses. Our other mattresses can be rotated. We recommend rotating the mattress after six months and then once a year after that. This will ensure that the surface of the mattress breaks in evenly. How do I clean my mattress? Expand/Collapse As part of regular maintenance, vacuum your mattress at least twice a year to get rid of dust, crumbs, and other icky things that might be living in there. You can also deodorize your mattress by generously sprinkling it with baking soda. Leave it on for a full day and then vacuum it up to refresh your mattress. Tip: Adding a mattress pad over your mattress gives it an added layer of protection from stains, moisture, and debris. Just make sure to wash your mattress pad regularly. For more mattress care tips, check out this blog . Is Saatva a bed in a box? Expand/Collapse No. Bed in a box (BIAB) mattresses are compressed, shrink-wrapped, folded, then rolled into a cardboard box for shipping. While this allows BIAB companies to save on freight costs, it takes a severe toll on the integrity of the foam mattress by breaking down the cell structure of the foams. It can also result in uneven firmness and sinking support in some areas, reducing the overall lifespan of the mattress. We believe your bed deserves better than being stuffed in a box. That’s why all Saatva mattresses come with FREE white glove delivery and in-home set up. We even take away your old mattress for free! How do I choose the right mattress height? Expand/Collapse Personal and aesthetic preferences are among the factors to consider when choosing the ideal mattress height/thickness. As a rule, mattress thickness alone is not an indicator of quality; that's more a function of mattress material and construction. A thicker mattress might be right for you if: • You have a larger body or are taller • You want to get on and off your bed with ease • Your bed frame or headboard requires a thicker/taller mattress A thinner mattress might be right for you if: • You don’t want to deal with a heavier mattress • You're shorter and don’t want to climb up into bed • You don’t want to purchase deep pocket or extra-deep pocket sheets Below are the heights (or thicknesses) of our Saatva mattresses: • Saatva Classic: 11.5" or 14.5" • Contour5: 12.5" • Latex Hybrid: 12" • Zenhaven: 10" • Saatva HD: 15.5" • Solaire: 13" • Memory Foam Hybrid: 11.5" • Rx: 15" If you place your mattress on a foundation, Saatva foundations are available in standard height (8.75") and low profile (4.75"). You can mix and match the thickness of a mattress and foundation to get the overall bed height that works best for you. Read our blog to learn more about finding the perfect mattress height for you. What are the weights of the mattresses? Expand/Collapse Saatva Classic: Twin: 11.5'' = 90 lbs. 14.5'' = 100 lbs. Twin XL: 11.5'' = 95 lbs. 14.5'' = 105 lbs. Full: 11.5'' = 100 lbs. 14.5'' = 110 lbs. Queen: 11.5'' = 110 lbs. 14.5'' = 120 lbs. King/Cal King: 11.5'' = 130 lbs. 14.5'' = 145 lbs. Split King (two Twin XLs): 11.5'' = 95 lbs. each 14.5'' = 105 lbs. each Contour5: Twin: 55 lbs. Twin XL: 59 lbs. Full: 77 lbs. Queen: 92 lbs. King/Cal King: 116 lbs. Split King: 118 lbs./59 lbs. each Zenhaven: Twin: 80 lbs. Twin XL: 82 lbs. Full: 100 lbs. Queen: 125 lbs. King/King Upper-Flex/Cal King: 165 lbs. Split King: 164 lbs./82 lbs. each Solaire: Twin XL: 85 lbs. Full: 106 lbs. Queen/Queen Upper-Flex: 114 lbs. King/King Upper-Flex/Cal King: 135 lbs. Split King: 170 lbs./85 lbs. each Saatva HD: Twin: 80 lbs. Twin XL: 85 lbs. Full: 110 lbs. Queen: 135 lbs. King/Cal King: 169 lbs. Split King: 170 lbs./85 lbs. each Latex Hybrid: Twin: 77 lbs. Twin XL: 85 lbs. Full: 115 lbs. Queen: 120 lbs. King: 150 lbs. Cal King: 148 lbs. Split King: 170 lbs./85 lbs. each Memory Foam Hybrid: Twin: 43 lbs. Twin XL: 46 lbs. Full: 57 lbs. Queen: 70 lbs. King/Cal King: 86 lbs. Split King: 92 lbs./46 lbs. each Saatva Rx: Twin: 70 lbs. Twin XL: 76 lbs. Full: 99 lbs. Queen: 124 lbs. King/Cal King: 151 lbs. Split King: 152 lbs./76 lbs. each Saatva Youth: Twin: 45 lbs. Twin XL: 56 lbs. Full: 61 lbs. Saatva Crib mattress: 18 lbs./20 lbs. boxed Saatva Bunk & Trundle mattress: Twin: 34 lbs. Twin XL: 36 lbs. Full: 49 lbs. Dog Bed: Small: 7 lbs. Medium: 13 lbs. Large: 22.5 lbs. Will my Saatva mattress work with my existing box spring or foundation? Expand/Collapse You can use your existing box spring or foundation if: • You purchased your box spring or foundation within the last seven years • Your existing box spring or foundation is in good condition and provides sturdy center support NOTE: Saatva HD requires pairing with the HD Foundation for adequate support. Saatva mattresses also work with platform beds, without the need for a foundation or box spring. Please make sure your existing platform bed has the following: • A solid, durable surface. If your platform has a slatted support system, make sure the slats are spaced less than 4" apart. If they're not, you can add a 1/2" thick piece of plywood or a bunkie board over the slats for optimal support. This extra layer of support is needed because Saatva mattresses are heavier due to their premium quality materials • A proper center support. This means you must have a center leg in the middle of your platform bed frame NOTE: When used with our dual-sided Zenhaven mattress, you must add a solid surface over platform slats such as plywood, masonite board, or bunkie board. If you have any questions, you can reach one of our sleep guides 24/7 at 1-877-672-2882. What bed frames are Saatva mattresses compatible with? Expand/Collapse Saatva mattresses are compatible with any bed frame, including our Saatva bed frames. Our dual-sided Zenhaven latex mattresses cannot be placed directly on a platform bed frame with slats. You must cover the slats with a solid material, such as plywood or a bunkie board. Non-platform (standard) bed frames require a foundation and can be paired with any mattress. Note that we strongly suggest pairing the Saatva HD with the HD foundation, which is specifically designed to give it optimal support. Can I use an adjustable base with any mattress? Expand/Collapse Adjustable bases work with mattresses that are designed to flex without shifting the inner materials or weakening the structure. Saatva adjustable bases are compatible with the following Saatva mattresses: • Saatva Classic Luxury Hybrid Innerspring (11.5-inch height only) • Contour5 Cooling Memory Foam • Memory Foam Hybrid •Saatva Latex Hybrid •Zenhaven Latex •Solaire Adjustable •Saatva Rx If you'd like to pair your adjustable bed base with a non-Saatva mattress, contact the manufacturer to check if it's compatible with an adjustable base. What is a Split King mattress? Expand/Collapse A Split King mattress has the exact same dimensions as a king mattress, but made up of two separate Twin XL mattresses. This is a great option for those who have narrow entryways and staircases. Split King is also a great option for couples who want a king size mattress, but have different firmness preferences. Simply order two separate Twin XL mattresses in different comfort/firmness options. If ordering two different mattress styles, be mindful of the mattress heights for each mattress. Lastly, Split King mattresses are great paired with a Split King adjustable base so that each sleeper can control the head and foot incline/decline on their side independently from their partner. To order a Split King consisting of two different mattress types, add the two Twin XLs you want to your cart separately rather than selecting Split King size. If you need any assistance placing the order, give our sleep guides a call at 877-672-2882. What is CertiPUR-US®? Expand/Collapse Foams in the bedding or upholstered furniture that are CertiPUR-US® certified have been tested to meet their rigorous standards for emissions, content and durability. Specifically, the foam is: Made without formaldehyde Made without ozone depleters Made without phthalates regulated by the U.S. Consumer Product Safety Commission Made without mercury, lead and other heavy metals Low VOC (volatile organic compound) emissions for indoor air quality (less than 0.5 parts per million) Screened for relevant chemicals, including flame retardants, that are classified as carcinogens, mutagens or reproductive toxins and are harmful to human health *CertiPUR-US® is a registered trademark of the Alliance for Flexible Polyurethane Foam, Inc. What are the benefits of the Extend™ protection plan? Expand/Collapse The Extend™ protection plan provides peace of mind and financial protection for your mattress investment from accidental damage. This plan covers accidental stains and damage NOT covered by the Saatva mattress warranty, such as rips, tears and stains. This plan does not cover theft or damage caused by abuse or misuse. Plans are effective from the day your mattress is delivered. For more info about Extend™ accident protection, check out our Extend™ page. Can I try your mattresses in person? Expand/Collapse Yes! Our Saatva Viewing Rooms are inviting, pressure-free spaces to experience Saatva comfort in real life. What is on display to order at Saatva stores? Expand/Collapse All merchandise, including mattresses, select bed frames, and bedding products are on display to order in our Saatva Viewing Rooms across the country . Everything we have on display includes free white glove delivery or free ground shipping (for smaller goods like bedding). Typically, mattress orders are delivered from our factories within a 9-21 day time frame, depending on your zip code. Pillows, bedding products, and rugs come with a 45-day free return policy. Mattress toppers come with a 180-night home trial. Mattresses and bedroom furniture come with our 365-night home trial*. If you decide to return your mattress or furniture within that home trial period, we will issue you a refund of your purchase price. The only cost to you is a $99 processing fee. * Excludes adjustable bases which are not eligible for returns or exchanges. What is white glove delivery? Expand/Collapse White glove delivery is the Saatva service standard and comes free with every mattress, bedroom furniture, and rug order. While our teams don't actually wear white gloves, we do all the work for you. We hand-deliver your mattress and set it up in the room of your choice. We also take away your old mattress and foundation* if you select the "free mattress & foundation removal" at checkout—all at no extra charge! Typically, mattress orders are delivered from our factories within a 9-21 day time frame, depending on your zip code. Our bedroom furniture is also hand-delivered and assembled (if applicable) and bedroom rugs are delivered and set up in the room of your choice (rug area must be cleared of furniture by customer prior to delivery). You get all this for free as part of our premium white glove delivery service. *Note that our delivery teams won't take away the following items: • Waterbed bases • Standard metal bed frames • Sleep Number bases • Stained and/or damaged mattresses & foundations/box springs What if I need to return or exchange my mattress? Expand/Collapse If you aren't completely happy with your Saatva mattress or you decide to exchange your mattress for another Saatva mattress during your 365-night home trial, just give us a call at 1-877-672-2882. We’ll schedule a pick up of your mattress and issue a refund for the purchase price (taxes included) to your original method of payment if you are returning or start the exchange process. You’ll only pay a $99 processing fee and we’ll take care of the rest! Note that the most common reason people exchange is for a different mattress size or height, so be sure to measure the height of your bed frame, adjustable base, and/or foundation/box spring before ordering. You can also call one of our friendly sleep guides for assistance 24/7. We never resell returned mattresses. Instead, we donate them to veterans' shelters or offer them at cost to employees and associates across our network of more than 150 delivery partners. Can I expedite the delivery of my mattress? Expand/Collapse Every Saatva mattress is made to order, which means they don't sit in storage. Occasionally, we can shorten the delivery time when we have a change or cancellation from another order of the exact same product. This allows us to redirect that freshly made and sealed mattress to you. We’d love to help in any way if you need your mattress faster. Our friendly sleep guides are here for you 24/7 at 1-877-672-2882. What do I do if I think my mattress feels too firm when I receive it? Expand/Collapse All of our mattresses are made to order and arrive to you factory fresh. That means the high-quality materials inside them need a little bit of time to soften up. You should notice your new mattress begin to conform to your body after a few days. You may even notice continuing improvement for up to a month. Remember that your body will need some time to adjust to a brand new mattress. If you've been sleeping on an old mattress, your body likely got used to it, even if it didn't provide you with adequate support. That's why we give you a generous 365-night home trial to give you time to acclimate to your new mattress. If after a month or so, you still feel that your mattress is too firm (or too soft), give us a call at 1-877-672-2882 and one of our friendly sleep guides will be happy to help you. Does Saatva offer any discounts to first responders, veterans, active military & more? Expand/Collapse We offer a year-round $225 discount off orders of $1,000 or more to active military, veterans, first responders, government employees, nurses, teachers, senior citizens & students. To apply the discount, simply click on the "Discount for first responders & more" box at checkout. You will be prompted to register with ID.me to verify your status and receive the discount. Note that your cart will automatically apply the larger discount if there is a promotional sale on Saatva.com that is better than your ID.me discount. We also occasionally offer promotional sales for limited time periods on our products on Saatva.com and Saatva Viewing Rooms. To be one of the first to learn about our latest sales, sign up for our mailing list at our site footer or text BED to SAATVA (722882). You can unsubscribe at any time. Are your phone and store representatives on commission? Expand/Collapse No. It’s part of our pledge to be honest and transparent about what you’re buying. Saatva is committed to giving you honest guidance, even if it means directing you to another mattress brand that’s a better fit for you. In a regular mattress store environment, a commissioned employee makes more money when they sell you a particular brand, so you may get pressured into a choice that’s not right for you. That’s just not the Saatva way. What are the advantages of mattresses that are crafted in America? Expand/Collapse Mattresses crafted in the U.S.A. must meet strict health, safety, and environmental standards. The U.S. and the E.U. have the toughest regulations, but other countries may not offer the same protections. Knowing where your mattress is crafted makes it easier to ensure that the manufacturer adheres to guidelines that protect workers from danger and exploitation, such as labor regulations and minimum-wage laws. Reputable mattress manufacturers (like our network of 14 domestic factories) also work to minimize environmental impact by incorporating low-carbon-footprint processes and recycled materials into their products. Why am I being charged a mattress recycling fee? Expand/Collapse Laws in California, Connecticut, and Rhode Island require us to collect a small fee at checkout for every mattress, foundation, and adjustable base sold. The fees are used to fund recycling efforts in these states, as part of a program called Bye Bye Mattress. This program is operated by the Mattress Recycling Council, a nonprofit organization started by the mattress industry. The fees go toward the collection and processing of discarded mattresses and foundations. Per state laws, we have to collect the fee even if you don't plan on getting rid of your old mattress right now. Mattresses don't last forever—eventually, you'll have to discard your old one, and the fees will help cover the recycling costs when the time comes. About 20 million mattresses end up in U.S. landfills every year—that's about 55,000 per day—and that can take a toll on the environment. Since 2015, Bye Bye Mattress has helped reduce the number of mattresses that end up in landfills by recycling six million mattresses. Recycling a mattress has many benefits: It conserves resources, with recyclable materials such as foam padding, steel springs, and wooden frames being used to make new products; it creates recycling jobs; it reduces the number of illegally dumped mattresses; and it results in less reliance on landfills. + Don't just take our word for it 97.5% of customers surveyed said they would recommend Saatva to their friends and family* 91% of customers surveyed said they wake up more refreshed after sleeping on their Saatva than on their previous mattress* 95% of customers surveyed said that they are sleeping better on their Saatva than on their previous mattress* 93.1% of customers surveyed said that Saatva helped alleviate their NECK pain* 93.9% of customers surveyed said that Saatva helped alleviate their BACK pain* + Saatva has earned an A+ rating from the Better Business Bureau and 96% of Saatva customers are satisfied with their purchase**. See for yourself why we have the highest customer review ratings in the mattress industry. *From a recent Saatva customer satisfaction survey, which we conduct on a regular basis to ensure service, product, and overall quality standards. **Based off Saatva return rates. Customer Reviews Expand/Collapse Customer reviews Find the right bed setup for you Comfort starts from the ground up. The right bed base not only upgrades your sleep comfort, it can increase the lifespan of your mattress. Let's break down all of the options: Platform Bed Frame Standard Bed Frame + Foundation Foundation Adjustable Base This setup is great for: A sleek, low-profile look Those who prefer not to use a foundation or box spring Compatible with: Most mattresses NOTE: Must add a solid surface over the slats such as plywood, masonite board, or bunkie board, when used with the dual-sided Zenhaven Natural Latex Mattress. Shop platform bed frames Foundation vs. box spring: What’s the difference? A mattress foundation is a new & improved version of the old-fashioned box spring. Foundations use more stable wood support slats, while box springs use bouncier metal coils for support. This setup is great for: Making your bed the focal point of your bedroom Giving added height to your mattress Mattresses that require solid surface support (no slats), like our Zenhaven Latex Mattress & Saatva HD Compatible with: All mattresses (Our Saatva HD requires the HD foundation for optimal support) Shop mattress foundation Shop standard bed frames Foundation vs. box spring: What’s the difference? A mattress foundation is a new & improved version of the old-fashioned box spring. Foundations use more stable wood support slats, while box springs use bouncier metal coils for support. This setup is great for: Minimalists who want the simplest and least expensive bed setup Those who move often and don’t want to disassemble a large bed frame each time Compatible with: All mattresses (Our Saatva HD requires the HD foundation for optimal support) Optional Universal Frame sold separately Shop mattress foundation This setup is great for: Helping to relieve back & joint pain Those who enjoy reading, watching TV, or working from bed Having the freedom to raise the head and the feet of the mattress independently* * Feature only available on the Saatva Adjustable Base Plus Split King or Split Cal King sizes Compatible with: All Saatva mattresses except Saatva Classic 14.5” height & Saatva HD All Saatva bed frames except Sydney Platform Bed Frame and all storage bed frames Shop adjustable bases Made to order, never stuffed in a box Every Saatva mattress is handcrafted and assembled when you order it. Unlike other internet mattresses, we'd never dream of compressing our premium beds into a small box. Doing so can reduce its lifespan and compromise your comfort. Expand/Collapse Every Saatva mattress is crafted when you order it. We assemble all our mattresses in America with care and pride, using only the highest quality, globally sourced materials. We could have settled on cheaper materials and produced our mattresses elsewhere for higher profits, but we've never wavered in our commitment to quality. We believe it's the right thing to do for our customers, our American workers, and our economy. Eco-friendly materials Expand/Collapse Every Saatva Classic mattress features: • Cover made with organic cotton • Guardin™ botanical antimicrobial treatment • Eco-friendly foams that are CertiPUR-US®* certified to meet their rigorous standards for emissions, content and durability • Recycled steel coils • Flame retardant barrier made from natural thistle pulp without toxic chemical sprays or fiberglass • GREENGUARD®* Gold certified to help reduce indoor air pollution and your family’s risk of daily chemical exposure to potentially harmful substances like volatile organic compounds (VOCs) *CertiPUR-US® is a registered trademark of the Alliance for Flexible Polyurethane Foam, Inc., GREENGUARD® Gold is a trademark of UL LLC Delivery & setup Expand/Collapse Sit back and relax while we do all the work. Our free white glove delivery includes in-room delivery and set up. We'll even take away your old mattress at no additional cost to you. Just select free mattress removal at checkout. 365-night home trial Expand/Collapse At Saatva, we never pressure you to make up your mind quickly. All of our mattresses come with a 365-night home trial, so you have plenty of time to decide whether it’s right for you. If at any point during your home trial you’re not satisfied, just give us a call and we’ll come pick up the mattress and refund your money, less a $99 processing fee to cover our cost of gas and labor for the pickup. That’s it. + What is an innerspring mattress? Expand/Collapse The innerspring mattress gets its name from the metal support coils (also called springs) that form the core of the bed. This common mattress type is known for its springy, responsive feel. A basic innerspring mattress will last you about 7-8 years. Keep in mind that material quality is a big contributing factor to how long an innerspring mattress will last. High-quality innerspring mattresses like our Saatva Classic can last 10-15 years with normal use. For more on mattress lifespans, check out our blog . Does coil count matter? Expand/Collapse Generally speaking, coil count is a good indicator of the overall comfort, support, and durability that a mattress offers. The number of coils in a mattress depends on its size. Typically, the standard for queen innerspring mattresses is 800 coils. The queen size of our Saatva Classic Innerspring Mattress features 884 individually pocketed coils that respond to your movements and limit motion transfer. What are the differences between innerspring and foam mattresses? Expand/Collapse The main difference between an innerspring mattress and a foam mattress comes down to the materials. An innerspring has a core support system made of coiled metal springs, while a foam mattress is made up of layers of polyurethane or viscoelastic (memory) foams. Memory foam mattresses generally offer a body-hugging feel. Innerspring mattresses generally have a bouncy, springy feel. While both mattress types have a lot of inherent differences, the choice between the two really comes down to individual preferences. That's why a great in-home trial period (like our 365-day home trial) is so crucial to making the most confident choice in your next mattress. What are individually wrapped coil innerspring mattresses? Expand/Collapse This type of innerspring mattress features individually wrapped metal spring coils. The two main advantages to individually wrapped coils are: 1) they conform and respond to your curves better than open coils and 2) they limit motion transfer because the coils move independently. How many coils are inside the Saatva Classic? Expand/Collapse The coil count varies by size: TWIN: Pocketed coils: 512 Support coils (base): 240 TOTAL: 752 TWIN XL: Pocketed coils: 544 Support coils(base): 260 TOTAL: 804 FULL: Pocketed coils: 704 Support coils (base): 336 TOTAL: 1,040 QUEEN: Pocketed coils: 884 Support coils (base): 416 TOTAL: 1,300 KING & SPLIT KING: Pocketed coils: 1,088 Support coils (base): 520 TOTAL: 1,608 CAL KING & SPLIT CAL KING: Pocketed coils: 1,088 Support coils (base): 520 TOTAL: 1,608 Do Saatva mattresses contain fiberglass or a fiberglass sock? Expand/Collapse No. We never use fiberglass or toxic chemical flame retardants/barriers in any of our mattresses. Instead, we use either plant-based flame barriers, a Paladin flame barrier made with a blend of poly & rayon fibers, or organic New Zealand wool in our mattresses to meet federal safety standards. What flame retardants do Saatva mattresses use? Expand/Collapse The following Saatva mattresses use a natural, plant-based thistle flame retardant made of wood pulp bonded with a small amount of polyester: • Saatva Classic • Saatva HD • Saatva Youth • Memory Foam Hybrid (also contains natural wool as a flame retardant) The following Saatva mattresses use 100% GOTS certified organic New Zealand wool as a natural flame retardant: • Zenhaven Latex • Saatva Latex Hybrid • Crib Mattress Solaire adjustable firmness mattress uses Paladin, which is composed of flame retardant rayon fibers blended with polyester fibers. Contour5 memory foam mattress is covered on all six sides with a GREENGUARD®* Gold Certified natural flame barrier made of nontoxic cellulose fibers derived from tree byproducts. Bunk & Trundle mattress uses a nontoxic natural thistle & wool blend flame barrier. We do not use any harmful chemicals or sprays in any of our mattresses. Do I need to flip over or rotate my mattress regularly? Expand/Collapse Our Zenhaven, Latex Hybrid, Saatva HD, and Solaire mattresses do not need to be rotated from head to foot. This is due to the 5-zone alignment of the latex layer in those mattresses. Our other mattresses can be rotated. We recommend rotating the mattress after six months and then once a year after that. This will ensure that the surface of the mattress breaks in evenly. How do I clean my mattress? Expand/Collapse As part of regular maintenance, vacuum your mattress at least twice a year to get rid of dust, crumbs, and other icky things that might be living in there. You can also deodorize your mattress by generously sprinkling it with baking soda. Leave it on for a full day and then vacuum it up to refresh your mattress. Tip: Adding a mattress pad over your mattress gives it an added layer of protection from stains, moisture, and debris. Just make sure to wash your mattress pad regularly. For more mattress care tips, check out this blog . What is the best mattress for back pain? Expand/Collapse Picking the right mattress to help ease back pain starts with assessing your typical sleep position, then choosing a mattress firmness that best supports you in that position. Saatva mattresses are the only ones with patented Lumbar Zone® Technology. That means every Saatva mattress is designed with dedicated lumbar support at the center third of the mattress where you need it most. Benefits of this lumbar zone support include better spinal alignment, circulation, and pressure relief. Is Saatva a bed in a box? Expand/Collapse No. Bed in a box (BIAB) mattresses are compressed, shrink-wrapped, folded, then rolled into a cardboard box for shipping. While this allows BIAB companies to save on freight costs, it takes a severe toll on the integrity of the foam mattress by breaking down the cell structure of the foams. It can also result in uneven firmness and sinking support in some areas, reducing the overall lifespan of the mattress. We believe your bed deserves better than being stuffed in a box. That’s why all Saatva mattresses come with FREE white glove delivery and in-home set up. We even take away your old mattress for free! What flame retardants do Saatva mattresses use? Expand/Collapse The following Saatva mattresses use a natural, plant-based thistle flame retardant made of wood pulp bonded with a small amount of polyester: • Saatva Classic • Saatva HD • Saatva Youth • Memory Foam Hybrid (also contains natural wool as a flame retardant) The following Saatva mattresses use 100% GOTS certified organic New Zealand wool as a natural flame retardant: • Zenhaven Latex • Saatva Latex Hybrid • Crib Mattress Solaire adjustable firmness mattress uses Paladin, which is composed of flame retardant rayon fibers blended with polyester fibers. Contour5 memory foam mattress is covered on all six sides with a GREENGUARD®* Gold Certified natural flame barrier made of nontoxic cellulose fibers derived from tree byproducts. Bunk & Trundle mattress uses a nontoxic natural thistle & wool blend flame barrier. We do not use any harmful chemicals or sprays in any of our mattresses. How do I choose the right mattress height? Expand/Collapse Personal and aesthetic preferences are among the factors to consider when choosing the ideal mattress height/thickness. As a rule, mattress thickness alone is not an indicator of quality; that's more a function of mattress material and construction. A thicker mattress might be right for you if: • You have a larger body or are taller • You want to get on and off your bed with ease • Your bed frame or headboard requires a thicker/taller mattress A thinner mattress might be right for you if: • You don’t want to deal with a heavier mattress • You're shorter and don’t want to climb up into bed • You don’t want to purchase deep pocket or extra-deep pocket sheets Below are the heights (or thicknesses) of our Saatva mattresses: • Saatva Classic: 11.5" or 14.5" • Contour5: 12.5" • Latex Hybrid: 12" • Zenhaven: 10" • Saatva HD: 15.5" • Solaire: 13" • Memory Foam Hybrid: 11.5" • Rx: 15" If you place your mattress on a foundation, Saatva foundations are available in standard height (8.75") and low profile (4.75"). You can mix and match the thickness of a mattress and foundation to get the overall bed height that works best for you. Read our blog to learn more about finding the perfect mattress height for you. Twin XL: 85 lbs. Full: 115 lbs. Queen: 120 lbs. King: 150 lbs. Cal King: 148 lbs. Split King: 170 lbs./85 lbs. each Memory Foam Hybrid: Twin: 43 lbs. Twin XL: 46 lbs. Full: 57 lbs. Queen: 70 lbs.
