Full: 49 lbs. Dog Bed: Small: 7 lbs. Medium: 13 lbs. Large: 22.5 lbs. Will my Saatva mattress work with my existing box spring or foundation? Expand/Collapse You can use your existing box spring or foundation if: • You purchased your box spring or foundation within the last seven years • Your existing box spring or foundation is in good condition and provides sturdy center support NOTE: Saatva HD requires pairing with the HD Foundation for adequate support. Saatva mattresses also work with platform beds, without the need for a foundation or box spring. Please make sure your existing platform bed has the following: • A solid, durable surface. If your platform has a slatted support system, make sure the slats are spaced less than 4" apart. If they're not, you can add a 1/2" thick piece of plywood or a bunkie board over the slats for optimal support. This extra layer of support is needed because Saatva mattresses are heavier due to their premium quality materials • A proper center support. This means you must have a center leg in the middle of your platform bed frame NOTE: When used with our dual-sided Zenhaven mattress, you must add a solid surface over platform slats such as plywood, masonite board, or bunkie board. If you have any questions, you can reach one of our sleep guides 24/7 at 1-877-672-2882. What bed frames are Saatva mattresses compatible with? Expand/Collapse Saatva mattresses are compatible with any bed frame, including our Saatva bed frames. Our dual-sided Zenhaven latex mattresses cannot be placed directly on a platform bed frame with slats. You must cover the slats with a solid material, such as plywood or a bunkie board. Non-platform (standard) bed frames require a foundation and can be paired with any mattress. Note that we strongly suggest pairing the Saatva HD with the HD foundation, which is specifically designed to give it optimal support. Can I use an adjustable base with any mattress? Expand/Collapse Adjustable bases work with mattresses that are designed to flex without shifting the inner materials or weakening the structure. Saatva adjustable bases are compatible with the following Saatva mattresses: • Saatva Classic Luxury Hybrid Innerspring (11.5-inch height only) • Contour5 Cooling Memory Foam • Memory Foam Hybrid •Saatva Latex Hybrid •Zenhaven Latex •Solaire Adjustable •Saatva Rx If you'd like to pair your adjustable bed base with a non-Saatva mattress, contact the manufacturer to check if it's compatible with an adjustable base. Are Saatva mattresses compatible with murphy beds? Expand/Collapse The following Saatva mattresses are compatible with Murphy beds: 11.5'' height Saatva Classic Contour5 Memory Foam Hybrid Bunk & Trundle Mattress Saatva Latex Hybrid These mattresses work with Murphy beds, provided the bed frame is compatible with the height/thickness of the mattress. It's very important to check with the manufacturer of your Murphy bed frame to see the maximum allowed mattress height/thickness and weight capacity  before purchasing a mattress for it. What is a Split King mattress? Expand/Collapse A Split King mattress has the exact same dimensions as a king mattress, but made up of two separate Twin XL mattresses. This is a great option for those who have narrow entryways and staircases. Split King is also a great option for couples who want a king size mattress, but have different firmness preferences. Simply order two separate Twin XL mattresses in different comfort/firmness options. If ordering two different mattress styles, be mindful of the mattress heights for each mattress. Lastly, Split King mattresses are great paired with a Split King adjustable base so that each sleeper can control the head and foot incline/decline on their side independently from their partner. To order a Split King consisting of two different mattress types, add the two Twin XLs you want to your cart separately rather than selecting Split King size. If you need any assistance placing the order, give our sleep guides a call at 877-672-2882. What is CertiPUR-US®? Expand/Collapse Foams in the bedding or upholstered furniture that are CertiPUR-US® certified have been tested to meet their rigorous standards for emissions, content and durability. Specifically, the foam is: Made without formaldehyde Made without ozone depleters Made without phthalates regulated by the U.S. Consumer Product Safety Commission Made without mercury, lead and other heavy metals Low VOC (volatile organic compound) emissions for indoor air quality (less than 0.5 parts per million) Screened for relevant chemicals, including flame retardants, that are classified as carcinogens, mutagens or reproductive toxins and are harmful to human health *CertiPUR-US® is a registered trademark of the Alliance for Flexible Polyurethane Foam, Inc. What is GREENGUARD Gold certified? Expand/Collapse The UL GREENGUARD Gold* Certification Standard includes health-based criteria for additional chemicals and requires lower total VOC (volatile organic compounds) emissions levels to ensure that products are acceptable for use in environments such as schools and healthcare facilities. In addition to limiting emissions of more than 360 VOCs and total chemical emissions, UL GREENGUARD Gold Certified products must also comply with the requirements of the California Department of Public Health (CDPH) Standard Method for the Testing and Evaluation of Volatile Organic Chemical Emissions from Indoor Sources Using Environmental Chambers, also known as California Section 01350. All certified products are subject to a review of the manufacturing process and routine testing to demonstrate minimal impact on the indoor environment in the long period. By purchasing products that carry this certification, you’re helping reduce indoor air pollution and your family’s risk of daily chemical exposure to potentially harmful substances. *GREENGUARD Gold is a trademark of UL LLC What's in your exclusive Guardin™ antimicrobial treatment? Expand/Collapse Our exclusive antimicrobial treatment by Guardin™ is made with a proprietary blend of essential oils and minerals. This blend includes thyme, geranium, lemongrass, and mint, but is completely odorless and colorless. Added to Saatva’s mattress ticking during the manufacturing process and engineered to last the life of the mattress, Guardin™ inhibits the growth of bacteria, mold, mildew, and the discoloration that they can cause on the surface of a mattress. Unlike other mattress brands that use antimicrobial treatments made from heavy metals, Guardin™ antimicrobial treatment is biodegradable and does not contain any fluorocarbons, toxic heavy metals, silver nanotechnology, triclosan, formaldehyde or phthalates. What are the benefits of the Extend™ protection plan? Expand/Collapse The Extend™ protection plan provides peace of mind and financial protection for your mattress investment from accidental damage. This plan covers accidental stains and damage NOT covered by the Saatva mattress warranty, such as rips, tears and stains. This plan does not cover theft or damage caused by abuse or misuse. Plans are effective from the day your mattress is delivered. For more info about Extend™ accident protection, check out our Extend™ page. Can I try your mattresses in person? Expand/Collapse Yes! Our Saatva Viewing Rooms are inviting, pressure-free spaces to experience Saatva comfort in real life. What is on display to order at Saatva stores? Expand/Collapse All merchandise, including mattresses, select bed frames, and bedding products are on display to order in our Saatva Viewing Rooms across the country . Everything we have on display includes free white glove delivery or free ground shipping (for smaller goods like bedding). Typically, mattress orders are delivered from our factories within a 9-21 day time frame, depending on your zip code. Pillows, bedding products, and rugs come with a 45-day free return policy. Mattress toppers come with a 180-night home trial. Mattresses and bedroom furniture come with our 365-night home trial*. If you decide to return your mattress or furniture within that home trial period, we will issue you a refund of your purchase price. The only cost to you is a $99 processing fee. * Excludes adjustable bases which are not eligible for returns or exchanges. What is white glove delivery? Expand/Collapse White glove delivery is the Saatva service standard and comes free with every mattress, bedroom furniture, and rug order. While our teams don't actually wear white gloves, we do all the work for you. We hand-deliver your mattress and set it up in the room of your choice. We also take away your old mattress and foundation* if you select the "free mattress & foundation removal" at checkout—all at no extra charge! Typically, mattress orders are delivered from our factories within a 9-21 day time frame, depending on your zip code. Our bedroom furniture is also hand-delivered and assembled (if applicable) and bedroom rugs are delivered and set up in the room of your choice (rug area must be cleared of furniture by customer prior to delivery). You get all this for free as part of our premium white glove delivery service. *Note that our delivery teams won't take away the following items: • Waterbed bases • Standard metal bed frames • Sleep Number bases • Stained and/or damaged mattresses & foundations/box springs What if I need to return or exchange my mattress? Expand/Collapse If you aren't completely happy with your Saatva mattress or you decide to exchange your mattress for another Saatva mattress during your 365-night home trial, just give us a call at 1-877-672-2882. We’ll schedule a pick up of your mattress and issue a refund for the purchase price (taxes included) to your original method of payment if you are returning or start the exchange process. You’ll only pay a $99 processing fee and we’ll take care of the rest! Note that the most common reason people exchange is for a different mattress size or height, so be sure to measure the height of your bed frame, adjustable base, and/or foundation/box spring before ordering. You can also call one of our friendly sleep guides for assistance 24/7. We never resell returned mattresses. Instead, we donate them to veterans' shelters or offer them at cost to employees and associates across our network of more than 150 delivery partners. Can I expedite the delivery of my mattress? Expand/Collapse Every Saatva mattress is made to order, which means they don't sit in storage. Occasionally, we can shorten the delivery time when we have a change or cancellation from another order of the exact same product. This allows us to redirect that freshly made and sealed mattress to you. We’d love to help in any way if you need your mattress faster. Our friendly sleep guides are here for you 24/7 at 1-877-672-2882. What do I do if I think my mattress feels too firm when I receive it? Expand/Collapse All of our mattresses are made to order and arrive to you factory fresh. That means the high-quality materials inside them need a little bit of time to soften up. You should notice your new mattress begin to conform to your body after a few days. You may even notice continuing improvement for up to a month. Remember that your body will need some time to adjust to a brand new mattress. If you've been sleeping on an old mattress, your body likely got used to it, even if it didn't provide you with adequate support. That's why we give you a generous 365-night home trial to give you time to acclimate to your new mattress. If after a month or so, you still feel that your mattress is too firm (or too soft), give us a call at 1-877-672-2882 and one of our friendly sleep guides will be happy to help you. Does Saatva offer any discounts to first responders, veterans, active military & more? Expand/Collapse We offer a year-round $225 discount off orders of $1,000 or more to active military, veterans, first responders, government employees, nurses, teachers, senior citizens & students. To apply the discount, simply click on the "Discount for first responders & more" box at checkout. You will be prompted to register with ID.me to verify your status and receive the discount. Note that your cart will automatically apply the larger discount if there is a promotional sale on Saatva.com that is better than your ID.me discount. We also occasionally offer promotional sales for limited time periods on our products on Saatva.com and Saatva Viewing Rooms. To be one of the first to learn about our latest sales, sign up for our mailing list at our site footer or text BED to SAATVA (722882). You can unsubscribe at any time. Are your phone and store representatives on commission? Expand/Collapse No. It’s part of our pledge to be honest and transparent about what you’re buying. Saatva is committed to giving you honest guidance, even if it means directing you to another mattress brand that’s a better fit for you. In a regular mattress store environment, a commissioned employee makes more money when they sell you a particular brand, so you may get pressured into a choice that’s not right for you. That’s just not the Saatva way. What are the advantages of mattresses that are crafted in America? Expand/Collapse Mattresses crafted in the U.S.A. must meet strict health, safety, and environmental standards. The U.S. and the E.U. have the toughest regulations, but other countries may not offer the same protections. Knowing where your mattress is crafted makes it easier to ensure that the manufacturer adheres to guidelines that protect workers from danger and exploitation, such as labor regulations and minimum-wage laws. Reputable mattress manufacturers (like our network of 14 domestic factories) also work to minimize environmental impact by incorporating low-carbon-footprint processes and recycled materials into their products. Why am I being charged a mattress recycling fee? Expand/Collapse Laws in California, Connecticut, and Rhode Island require us to collect a small fee at checkout for every mattress, foundation, and adjustable base sold. The fees are used to fund recycling efforts in these states, as part of a program called Bye Bye Mattress. This program is operated by the Mattress Recycling Council, a nonprofit organization started by the mattress industry. The fees go toward the collection and processing of discarded mattresses and foundations. Per state laws, we have to collect the fee even if you don't plan on getting rid of your old mattress right now. Mattresses don't last forever—eventually, you'll have to discard your old one, and the fees will help cover the recycling costs when the time comes. About 20 million mattresses end up in U.S. landfills every year—that's about 55,000 per day—and that can take a toll on the environment. Since 2015, Bye Bye Mattress has helped reduce the number of mattresses that end up in landfills by recycling six million mattresses. Recycling a mattress has many benefits: It conserves resources, with recyclable materials such as foam padding, steel springs, and wooden frames being used to make new products; it creates recycling jobs; it reduces the number of illegally dumped mattresses; and it results in less reliance on landfills. + Don't just take our word for it 97.5% of customers surveyed said they would recommend Saatva to their friends and family* 91% of customers surveyed said they wake up more refreshed after sleeping on their Saatva than on their previous mattress* 95% of customers surveyed said that they are sleeping better on their Saatva than on their previous mattress* 93.1% of customers surveyed said that Saatva helped alleviate their NECK pain* 93.9% of customers surveyed said that Saatva helped alleviate their BACK pain* + Saatva has earned an A+ rating from the Better Business Bureau and 96% of Saatva customers are satisfied with their purchase**. See for yourself why we have the highest customer review ratings in the mattress industry. *From a recent Saatva customer satisfaction survey, which we conduct on a regular basis to ensure service, product, and overall quality standards. **Based off Saatva return rates. Customer Reviews Expand/Collapse Customer reviews Find the right bed setup for you Comfort starts from the ground up. The right bed base not only upgrades your sleep comfort, it can increase the lifespan of your mattress. Let's break down all of the options: Platform Bed Frame Standard Bed Frame + Foundation Foundation Adjustable Base This setup is great for: A sleek, low-profile look Those who prefer not to use a foundation or box spring Compatible with: Most mattresses NOTE: Must add a solid surface over the slats such as plywood, masonite board, or bunkie board, when used with the dual-sided Zenhaven Natural Latex Mattress. Shop platform bed frames Foundation vs. box spring: What’s the difference? A mattress foundation is a new & improved version of the old-fashioned box spring. Foundations use more stable wood support slats, while box springs use bouncier metal coils for support. This setup is great for: Making your bed the focal point of your bedroom Giving added height to your mattress Mattresses that require solid surface support (no slats), like our Zenhaven Latex Mattress & Saatva HD Compatible with: All mattresses (Our Saatva HD requires the HD foundation for optimal support) Shop mattress foundation Shop standard bed frames Foundation vs. box spring: What’s the difference? A mattress foundation is a new & improved version of the old-fashioned box spring. Foundations use more stable wood support slats, while box springs use bouncier metal coils for support. This setup is great for: Minimalists who want the simplest and least expensive bed setup Those who move often and don’t want to disassemble a large bed frame each time Compatible with: All mattresses (Our Saatva HD requires the HD foundation for optimal support) Optional Universal Frame sold separately Shop mattress foundation This setup is great for: Helping to relieve back & joint pain Those who enjoy reading, watching TV, or working from bed Having the freedom to raise the head and the feet of the mattress independently* * Feature only available on the Saatva Adjustable Base Plus Split King or Split Cal King sizes Compatible with: All Saatva mattresses except Saatva Classic 14.5” height & Saatva HD All Saatva bed frames except Sydney Platform Bed Frame and all storage bed frames Shop adjustable bases Made to order, never stuffed in a box Every Saatva mattress is handcrafted and assembled when you order it. Unlike other internet mattresses, we'd never dream of compressing our premium beds into a small box. Doing so can reduce its lifespan and compromise your comfort. TWIN: 38" x 75" TWIN XL: 38" x 80" FULL: 54" x 75" QUEEN: 60" x 80" KING/SPLIT*: 76" x 80" CAL KING: 72" x 84" * Split King consists of two Twin XLs Mattress weights & weight limit Expand/Collapse TWIN XL: 46 lbs. FULL: 57 lbs. QUEEN: 70 lbs. KING/CAL-KING: 86 lbs. SPLIT KING: 92 lbs./46 lbs. each Mattress weight limit: Up to 300 lbs. per sleeper Crafted in the U.S.A. Expand/Collapse Every Saatva mattress is crafted when you order it. We assemble all our mattresses in America with care and pride, using only the highest quality, globally sourced materials. We could have settled on cheaper materials and produced our mattresses elsewhere for higher profits, but we've never wavered in our commitment to quality. We believe it's the right thing to do for our customers, our American workers, and our economy. Eco-friendly materials Expand/Collapse Every Memory Foam Hybrid mattress features: • Cover made with organic cotton • Guardin™ botanical antimicrobial treatment • Eco-friendly foams that are CertiPUR-US®* certified to meet their rigorous standards for emissions, content and durability • Recycled steel coils • Flame retardant barrier made from natural thistle pulp without toxic chemical sprays or fiberglass • Base panels on our single-sided mattresses are made with REPREVE® recycled polyester which removes four single-use plastic bottles from the waste stream with every Queen mattress made *CertiPUR-US® is a registered trademark of the Alliance for Flexible Polyurethane Foam, Inc. Delivery & setup Expand/Collapse Sit back and relax while we do all the work. Our free white glove delivery includes in-room delivery and set up. We'll even take away your old mattress at no additional cost to you. Just select free mattress removal at checkout. 365-night home trial Expand/Collapse At Saatva, we never pressure you to make up your mind quickly. All of our mattresses come with a 365-night home trial, so you have plenty of time to decide whether it’s right for you. If at any point during your home trial you’re not satisfied, just give us a call and we’ll come pick up the mattress and refund your money, less a $99 processing fee to cover our cost of gas and labor for the pickup. That’s it. + What is a hybrid foam mattress? Expand/Collapse Memory Foam Hybrid is a hybrid foam mattress that combines the deep, body-contouring support of memory foam with the responsive support and "springy" feel of an innerspring mattress. They're great for just about all types of sleepers, whether you're a back sleeper, side sleeper, or a combination of both. What is memory foam made of? Expand/Collapse Memory foam, also known as viscoelastic foam, is a type of high-density polyurethane foam. Its distinguishing feature is that it softens in response to heat and pressure. That’s what gives memory foam mattresses their body-hugging, body-contouring feel. How long do memory foam mattresses last? Expand/Collapse The durability of a foam mattress can vary greatly depending on the quality and density of the foams. A premium, high-quality memory foam mattress should last you anywhere from 10 to 15 years. Are memory foam mattresses hot? Expand/Collapse Traditional foam mattresses have a tendency to trap body heat, but new technologies like gel-infused memory foams have come a long way in helping you sleep cooler. Saatva memory foam mattresses also feature covers made naturally breathable organic cotton. If you tend to sleep hot, placing your memory foam mattress on a box spring or a platform with open slats will help increase overall airflow. It’s also a great idea to top off your mattress with breathable sheets made from natural fabrics to create a cooler, more comfortable sleep environment all around. Are memory foam mattresses good for my back? Expand/Collapse Yes. Memory foam mattresses conform to your body, helping to keep your spine in a healthy, neutral alignment in any sleep position. Consider your preferred sleeping position when shopping for a foam mattress. If you’re a side sleeper, a softer foam mattress may help reduce pressure on your shoulders and hips. If you sleep on your back or stomach, a medium-firm comfort level or firmer will prevent your hips from sinking too deeply into the mattress. Are memory foam mattresses safe? Expand/Collapse We only use nontoxic CertiPUR-US® certified foams in our mattresses. This means that the foams are made without CFCs and other ozone depleters. They also don’t use PBDEs, TDCPP, or TCEP ("Tris"), which are flame retardants that have been identified by the Globally Harmonized System (GHS) as substances that may cause cancer, genetic defects, or damage fertility. CertiPUR-US® compliant foams are free of phthalates, formaldehyde, and mercury, lead, or other heavy metals. They're also tested to verify low VOC (volatile organic compound) emissions, so your mattress won’t off-gas in your home. Do Saatva mattresses contain fiberglass or a fiberglass sock? Expand/Collapse No. We never use fiberglass or toxic chemical flame retardants/barriers in any of our mattresses. Instead, we use either plant-based flame barriers, a Paladin flame barrier made with a blend of poly & rayon fibers, or organic New Zealand wool in our mattresses to meet federal safety standards. What flame retardants do Saatva mattresses use? Expand/Collapse The following Saatva mattresses use a natural, plant-based thistle flame retardant made of wood pulp bonded with a small amount of polyester: • Saatva Classic • Saatva HD • Saatva Youth • Memory Foam Hybrid (also contains natural wool as a flame retardant) The following Saatva mattresses use 100% GOTS certified organic New Zealand wool as a natural flame retardant: • Zenhaven Latex • Saatva Latex Hybrid • Crib Mattress Solaire adjustable firmness mattress uses Paladin, which is composed of flame retardant rayon fibers blended with polyester fibers. Contour5 memory foam mattress is covered on all six sides with a GREENGUARD®* Gold Certified natural flame barrier made of nontoxic cellulose fibers derived from tree byproducts. Bunk & Trundle mattress uses a nontoxic natural thistle & wool blend flame barrier. We do not use any harmful chemicals or sprays in any of our mattresses. What is off gassing? Expand/Collapse Off gassing is the term for what happens when volatile organic compounds (VOCs) leak out of upholstery materials and mattress foams and into the air you breathe. Some people refer to this as a "new mattress smell" that can range from unpleasant to downright nauseating. Learn more on our blog about off gassing and how Saatva mattresses cut down or completely eliminate this common issue. Do I need to flip over or rotate my mattress regularly? Expand/Collapse Our Zenhaven, Latex Hybrid, Saatva HD, and Solaire mattresses do not need to be rotated from head to foot. This is due to the 5-zone alignment of the latex layer in those mattresses. Our other mattresses can be rotated. We recommend rotating the mattress after six months and then once a year after that. This will ensure that the surface of the mattress breaks in evenly. How do I clean my mattress? Expand/Collapse As part of regular maintenance, vacuum your mattress at least twice a year to get rid of dust, crumbs, and other icky things that might be living in there. You can also deodorize your mattress by generously sprinkling it with baking soda. Leave it on for a full day and then vacuum it up to refresh your mattress. Tip: Adding a mattress pad over your mattress gives it an added layer of protection from stains, moisture, and debris. Just make sure to wash your mattress pad regularly. For more mattress care tips, check out this blog . What is the best mattress for back pain? Expand/Collapse Picking the right mattress to help ease back pain starts with assessing your typical sleep position, then choosing a mattress firmness that best supports you in that position. Saatva mattresses are the only ones with patented Lumbar Zone® Technology. That means every Saatva mattress is designed with dedicated lumbar support at the center third of the mattress where you need it most. Benefits of this lumbar zone support include better spinal alignment, circulation, and pressure relief. Is Saatva a bed in a box? Expand/Collapse No. Bed in a box (BIAB) mattresses are compressed, shrink-wrapped, folded, then rolled into a cardboard box for shipping. While this allows BIAB companies to save on freight costs, it takes a severe toll on the integrity of the foam mattress by breaking down the cell structure of the foams. It can also result in uneven firmness and sinking support in some areas, reducing the overall lifespan of the mattress. We believe your bed deserves better than being stuffed in a box. That’s why all Saatva mattresses come with FREE white glove delivery and in-home set up. We even take away your old mattress for free! How do I choose the right mattress height? Expand/Collapse Personal and aesthetic preferences are among the factors to consider when choosing the ideal mattress height/thickness. As a rule, mattress thickness alone is not an indicator of quality; that's more a function of mattress material and construction. A thicker mattress might be right for you if: • You have a larger body or are taller • You want to get on and off your bed with ease • Your bed frame or headboard requires a thicker/taller mattress A thinner mattress might be right for you if: • You don’t want to deal with a heavier mattress • You're shorter and don’t want to climb up into bed • You don’t want to purchase deep pocket or extra-deep pocket sheets Below are the heights (or thicknesses) of our Saatva mattresses: • Saatva Classic: 11.5" or 14.5" • Contour5: 12.5" • Latex Hybrid: 12" • Zenhaven: 10" • Saatva HD: 15.5" • Solaire: 13" • Memory Foam Hybrid: 11.5" • Rx: 15" If you place your mattress on a foundation, Saatva foundations are available in standard height (8.75") and low profile (4.75"). You can mix and match the thickness of a mattress and foundation to get the overall bed height that works best for you. Read our blog to learn more about finding the perfect mattress height for you. Do hybrid mattresses need a box spring or foundation? Expand/Collapse You don’t need a box spring or foundation if you have a platform bed. Otherwise, if your existing foundation or bed support system is over 7 years old or is sagging or damaged in any way, we suggest getting a high-quality Saatva foundation to get the most out of your new mattress. Your mattress warranty remains in place even when you use your own existing foundation or box spring. What bed frames are Saatva mattresses compatible with? Expand/Collapse Saatva mattresses are compatible with any bed frame, including our Saatva bed frames. Our dual-sided Zenhaven latex mattresses cannot be placed directly on a platform bed frame with slats. You must cover the slats with a solid material, such as plywood or a bunkie board. Non-platform (standard) bed frames require a foundation and can be paired with any mattress. Note that we strongly suggest pairing the Saatva HD with the HD foundation, which is specifically designed to give it optimal support. Can I use an adjustable base with any mattress? Expand/Collapse Adjustable bases work with mattresses that are designed to flex without shifting the inner materials or weakening the structure. Saatva adjustable bases are compatible with the following Saatva mattresses: • Saatva Classic Luxury Hybrid Innerspring (11.5-inch height only) • Contour5 Cooling Memory Foam • Memory Foam Hybrid •Saatva Latex Hybrid •Zenhaven Latex •Solaire Adjustable •Saatva Rx If you'd like to pair your adjustable bed base with a non-Saatva mattress, contact the manufacturer to check if it's compatible with an adjustable base. Are Saatva mattresses compatible with murphy beds? Expand/Collapse The following Saatva mattresses are compatible with Murphy beds: 11.5'' height Saatva Classic Contour5 Memory Foam Hybrid Bunk & Trundle Mattress Saatva Latex Hybrid These mattresses work with Murphy beds, provided the bed frame is compatible with the height/thickness of the mattress. It's very important to check with the manufacturer of your Murphy bed frame to see the maximum allowed mattress height/thickness and weight capacity  before purchasing a mattress for it. Will my Saatva mattress work with my existing box spring or foundation? Expand/Collapse You can use your existing box spring or foundation if: • You purchased your box spring or foundation within the last seven years • Your existing box spring or foundation is in good condition and provides sturdy center support NOTE: Saatva HD requires pairing with the HD Foundation for adequate support. Saatva mattresses also work with platform beds, without the need for a foundation or box spring. Please make sure your existing platform bed has the following: • A solid, durable surface. If your platform has a slatted support system, make sure the slats are spaced less than 4" apart. If they're not, you can add a 1/2" thick piece of plywood or a bunkie board over the slats for optimal support. This extra layer of support is needed because Saatva mattresses are heavier due to their premium quality materials • A proper center support. This means you must have a center leg in the middle of your platform bed frame NOTE: When used with our dual-sided Zenhaven mattress, you must add a solid surface over platform slats such as plywood, masonite board, or bunkie board. If you have any questions, you can reach one of our sleep guides 24/7 at 1-877-672-2882. What is CertiPUR-US®? Expand/Collapse Foams in the bedding or upholstered furniture that are CertiPUR-US® certified have been tested to meet their rigorous standards for emissions, content and durability. Specifically, the foam is: Made without formaldehyde Made without ozone depleters Made without phthalates regulated by the U.S. Consumer Product Safety Commission Made without mercury, lead and other heavy metals Low VOC (volatile organic compound) emissions for indoor air quality (less than 0.5 parts per million) Screened for relevant chemicals, including flame retardants, that are classified as carcinogens, mutagens or reproductive toxins and are harmful to human health *CertiPUR-US® is a registered trademark of the Alliance for Flexible Polyurethane Foam, Inc. How do I choose the right mattress height? Expand/Collapse Personal and aesthetic preferences are among the factors to consider when choosing the ideal mattress height/thickness. As a rule, mattress thickness alone is not an indicator of quality; that's more a function of mattress material and construction. A thicker mattress might be right for you if: • You have a larger body or are taller • You want to get on and off your bed with ease • Your bed frame or headboard requires a thicker/taller mattress A thinner mattress might be right for you if: • You don’t want to deal with a heavier mattress • You're shorter and don’t want to climb up into bed • You don’t want to purchase deep pocket or extra-deep pocket sheets Below are the heights (or thicknesses) of our Saatva mattresses: • Saatva Classic: 11.5" or 14.5" • Contour5: 12.5" • Latex Hybrid: 12" • Zenhaven: 10" • Saatva HD: 15.5" • Solaire: 13" • Memory Foam Hybrid: 11.5" • Rx: 15" If you place your mattress on a foundation, Saatva foundations are available in standard height (8.75") and low profile (4.75"). You can mix and match the thickness of a mattress and foundation to get the overall bed height that works best for you. Read our blog to learn more about finding the perfect mattress height for you. What are the weights of the mattresses? Expand/Collapse Saatva Classic: Twin: 11.5'' = 90 lbs. 14.5'' = 100 lbs. Twin XL: 11.5'' = 95 lbs. 14.5'' = 105 lbs. Full: 11.5'' = 100 lbs. 14.5'' = 110 lbs. Queen: 11.5'' = 110 lbs. 14.5'' = 120 lbs. King/Cal King: 11.5'' = 130 lbs. 14.5'' = 145 lbs. Split King (two Twin XLs): 11.5'' = 95 lbs. each 14.5'' = 105 lbs. each Contour5: Twin: 55 lbs. Twin XL: 59 lbs. Full: 77 lbs. Queen: 92 lbs. King/Cal King: 116 lbs. Split King: 118 lbs./59 lbs. each Zenhaven: Twin: 80 lbs. Twin XL: 82 lbs. Full: 100 lbs. Queen: 125 lbs. King/King Upper-Flex/Cal King: 165 lbs. Split King: 164 lbs./82 lbs. each Solaire: Twin XL: 85 lbs. Full: 106 lbs. Queen/Queen Upper-Flex: 114 lbs. King/King Upper-Flex/Cal King: 135 lbs. Split King: 170 lbs./85 lbs. each Saatva HD: Twin: 80 lbs. Twin XL: 85 lbs. Full: 110 lbs. Queen: 135 lbs. King/Cal King: 169 lbs. Split King: 170 lbs./85 lbs. each Latex Hybrid: Twin: 77 lbs. Twin XL: 85 lbs. Full: 115 lbs. Queen: 120 lbs. King: 150 lbs. Cal King: 148 lbs. Split King: 170 lbs./85 lbs. each Memory Foam Hybrid: Twin: 43 lbs. Twin XL: 46 lbs. Full: 57 lbs. Queen: 70 lbs. King/Cal King: 86 lbs. Split King: 92 lbs./46 lbs. each Saatva Rx: Twin: 70 lbs. Twin XL: 76 lbs. Full: 99 lbs. Queen: 124 lbs. King/Cal King: 151 lbs. Split King: 152 lbs./76 lbs. each Saatva Youth: Twin: 45 lbs. Twin XL: 56 lbs. Full: 61 lbs. Saatva Crib mattress: 18 lbs./20 lbs. boxed Saatva Bunk & Trundle mattress: Twin: 34 lbs. Twin XL: 36 lbs. Full: 49 lbs. Dog Bed: Small: 7 lbs. Medium: 13 lbs. Large: 22.5 lbs. What's in your exclusive Guardin™ antimicrobial treatment? Expand/Collapse Our exclusive antimicrobial treatment by Guardin™ is made with a proprietary blend of essential oils and minerals. This blend includes thyme, geranium, lemongrass, and mint, but is completely odorless and colorless. Added to Saatva’s mattress ticking during the manufacturing process and engineered to last the life of the mattress, Guardin™ inhibits the growth of bacteria, mold, mildew, and the discoloration that they can cause on the surface of a mattress. Unlike other mattress brands that use antimicrobial treatments made from heavy metals, Guardin™ antimicrobial treatment is biodegradable and does not contain any fluorocarbons, toxic heavy metals, silver nanotechnology, triclosan, formaldehyde or phthalates. What are the benefits of the Extend™ protection plan? Expand/Collapse The Extend™ protection plan provides peace of mind and financial protection for your mattress investment from accidental damage. This plan covers accidental stains and damage NOT covered by the Saatva mattress warranty, such as rips, tears and stains. This plan does not cover theft or damage caused by abuse or misuse. Plans are effective from the day your mattress is delivered. For more info about Extend™ accident protection, check out our Extend™ page. Can I try your mattresses in person? Expand/Collapse Yes! Our Saatva Viewing Rooms are inviting, pressure-free spaces to experience Saatva comfort in real life. What is on display to order at Saatva stores? Expand/Collapse All merchandise, including mattresses, select bed frames, and bedding products are on display to order in our Saatva Viewing Rooms across the country . Everything we have on display includes free white glove delivery or free ground shipping (for smaller goods like bedding). Typically, mattress orders are delivered from our factories within a 9-21 day time frame, depending on your zip code. Pillows, bedding products, and rugs come with a 45-day free return policy. Mattress toppers come with a 180-night home trial. Mattresses and bedroom furniture come with our 365-night home trial*. If you decide to return your mattress or furniture within that home trial period, we will issue you a refund of your purchase price. The only cost to you is a $99 processing fee. * Excludes adjustable bases which are not eligible for returns or exchanges. What is white glove delivery? Expand/Collapse White glove delivery is the Saatva service standard and comes free with every mattress, bedroom furniture, and rug order. While our teams don't actually wear white gloves, we do all the work for you. We hand-deliver your mattress and set it up in the room of your choice. We also take away your old mattress and foundation* if you select the "free mattress & foundation removal" at checkout—all at no extra charge! Typically, mattress orders are delivered from our factories within a 9-21 day time frame, depending on your zip code. Our bedroom furniture is also hand-delivered and assembled (if applicable) and bedroom rugs are delivered and set up in the room of your choice (rug area must be cleared of furniture by customer prior to delivery). You get all this for free as part of our premium white glove delivery service. *Note that our delivery teams won't take away the following items: • Waterbed bases • Standard metal bed frames • Sleep Number bases • Stained and/or damaged mattresses & foundations/box springs What if I need to return or exchange my mattress? Expand/Collapse If you aren't completely happy with your Saatva mattress or you decide to exchange your mattress for another Saatva mattress during your 365-night home trial, just give us a call at 1-877-672-2882. We’ll schedule a pick up of your mattress and issue a refund for the purchase price (taxes included) to your original method of payment if you are returning or start the exchange process. You’ll only pay a $99 processing fee and we’ll take care of the rest! Note that the most common reason people exchange is for a different mattress size or height, so be sure to measure the height of your bed frame, adjustable base, and/or foundation/box spring before ordering. You can also call one of our friendly sleep guides for assistance 24/7. We never resell returned mattresses. Instead, we donate them to veterans' shelters or offer them at cost to employees and associates across our network of more than 150 delivery partners. Can I expedite the delivery of my mattress? Expand/Collapse Every Saatva mattress is made to order, which means they don't sit in storage. Occasionally, we can shorten the delivery time when we have a change or cancellation from another order of the exact same product. This allows us to redirect that freshly made and sealed mattress to you. We’d love to help in any way if you need your mattress faster. Our friendly sleep guides are here for you 24/7 at 1-877-672-2882. What do I do if I think my mattress feels too firm when I receive it? Expand/Collapse All of our mattresses are made to order and arrive to you factory fresh. That means the high-quality materials inside them need a little bit of time to soften up. You should notice your new mattress begin to conform to your body after a few days. You may even notice continuing improvement for up to a month. Remember that your body will need some time to adjust to a brand new mattress. If you've been sleeping on an old mattress, your body likely got used to it, even if it didn't provide you with adequate support. That's why we give you a generous 365-night home trial to give you time to acclimate to your new mattress. If after a month or so, you still feel that your mattress is too firm (or too soft), give us a call at 1-877-672-2882 and one of our friendly sleep guides will be happy to help you. Does Saatva offer any discounts to first responders, veterans, active military & more? Expand/Collapse We offer a year-round $225 discount off orders of $1,000 or more to active military, veterans, first responders, government employees, nurses, teachers, senior citizens & students. To apply the discount, simply click on the "Discount for first responders & more" box at checkout. You will be prompted to register with ID.me to verify your status and receive the discount. Note that your cart will automatically apply the larger discount if there is a promotional sale on Saatva.com that is better than your ID.me discount. We also occasionally offer promotional sales for limited time periods on our products on Saatva.com and Saatva Viewing Rooms. To be one of the first to learn about our latest sales, sign up for our mailing list at our site footer or text BED to SAATVA (722882). You can unsubscribe at any time. Are your phone and store representatives on commission? Expand/Collapse No. It’s part of our pledge to be honest and transparent about what you’re buying. Saatva is committed to giving you honest guidance, even if it means directing you to another mattress brand that’s a better fit for you. In a regular mattress store environment, a commissioned employee makes more money when they sell you a particular brand, so you may get pressured into a choice that’s not right for you. That’s just not the Saatva way. What are the advantages of mattresses that are crafted in America? Expand/Collapse Mattresses crafted in the U.S.A. must meet strict health, safety, and environmental standards. The U.S. and the E.U. have the toughest regulations, but other countries may not offer the same protections. Knowing where your mattress is crafted makes it easier to ensure that the manufacturer adheres to guidelines that protect workers from danger and exploitation, such as labor regulations and minimum-wage laws. Reputable mattress manufacturers (like our network of 14 domestic factories) also work to minimize environmental impact by incorporating low-carbon-footprint processes and recycled materials into their products. Why am I being charged a mattress recycling fee? Expand/Collapse Laws in California, Connecticut, and Rhode Island require us to collect a small fee at checkout for every mattress, foundation, and adjustable base sold. The fees are used to fund recycling efforts in these states, as part of a program called Bye Bye Mattress. This program is operated by the Mattress Recycling Council, a nonprofit organization started by the mattress industry. The fees go toward the collection and processing of discarded mattresses and foundations. Per state laws, we have to collect the fee even if you don't plan on getting rid of your old mattress right now. Mattresses don't last forever—eventually, you'll have to discard your old one, and the fees will help cover the recycling costs when the time comes. About 20 million mattresses end up in U.S. landfills every year—that's about 55,000 per day—and that can take a toll on the environment. Since 2015, Bye Bye Mattress has helped reduce the number of mattresses that end up in landfills by recycling six million mattresses. Recycling a mattress has many benefits: It conserves resources, with recyclable materials such as foam padding, steel springs, and wooden frames being used to make new products; it creates recycling jobs; it reduces the number of illegally dumped mattresses; and it results in less reliance on landfills. + Don't just take our word for it 97.5% of customers surveyed said they would recommend Saatva to their friends and family* 91% of customers surveyed said they wake up more refreshed after sleeping on their Saatva than on their previous mattress* 95% of customers surveyed said that they are sleeping better on their Saatva than on their previous mattress* 93.1% of customers surveyed said that Saatva helped alleviate their NECK pain* 93.9% of customers surveyed said that Saatva helped alleviate their BACK pain* + Saatva has earned an A+ rating from the Better Business Bureau and 96% of Saatva customers are satisfied with their purchase**. See for yourself why we have the highest customer review ratings in the mattress industry. *From a recent Saatva customer satisfaction survey, which we conduct on a regular basis to ensure service, product, and overall quality standards. **Based off Saatva return rates. Customer Reviews Expand/Collapse Customer reviews Find the right bed setup for you Comfort starts from the ground up. The right bed base not only upgrades your sleep comfort, it can increase the lifespan of your mattress. Let's break down all of the options: Platform Bed Frame Standard Bed Frame + Foundation Foundation Adjustable Base This setup is great for: A sleek, low-profile look Those who prefer not to use a foundation or box spring Compatible with: Most mattresses NOTE: Must add a solid surface over the slats such as plywood, masonite board, or bunkie board, when used with the dual-sided Zenhaven Natural Latex Mattress. Shop platform bed frames Foundation vs. box spring: What’s the difference? A mattress foundation is a new & improved version of the old-fashioned box spring. Foundations use more stable wood support slats, while box springs use bouncier metal coils for support. This setup is great for: Making your bed the focal point of your bedroom Giving added height to your mattress Mattresses that require solid surface support (no slats), like our Zenhaven Latex Mattress & Saatva HD Compatible with: All mattresses (Our Saatva HD requires the HD foundation for optimal support) Shop mattress foundation Shop standard bed frames Foundation vs. box spring: What’s the difference? A mattress foundation is a new & improved version of the old-fashioned box spring. Foundations use more stable wood support slats, while box springs use bouncier metal coils for support. This setup is great for: Minimalists who want the simplest and least expensive bed setup Those who move often and don’t want to disassemble a large bed frame each time Compatible with: All mattresses (Our Saatva HD requires the HD foundation for optimal support) Optional Universal Frame sold separately Shop mattress foundation This setup is great for: Helping to relieve back & joint pain Those who enjoy reading, watching TV, or working from bed Having the freedom to raise the head and the feet of the mattress independently* * Feature only available on the Saatva Adjustable Base Plus Split King or Split Cal King sizes Compatible with: All Saatva mattresses except Saatva Classic 14.5” height & Saatva HD All Saatva bed frames except Sydney Platform Bed Frame and all storage bed frames Shop adjustable bases Made to order, never stuffed in a box Every Saatva mattress is handcrafted and assembled when you order it. Unlike other internet mattresses, we'd never dream of compressing our premium beds into a small box. Doing so can reduce its lifespan and compromise your comfort. Premium quality without traditional retail markups We cut out the middlemen so you get the highest quality at the best possible value. To get the same quality elsewhere, you'd have to pay way more. Learn more Made to order, never stuffed in a box Every Saatva mattress is assembled and handcrafted when you order it.  Unlike other internet mattresses, we'd never dream of compressing our premium beds into a small box. Instead, we deliver it factory-fresh to your room for free. Learn more Sustainability is at the core of our brand From responsibly sourced materials to our domestic manufacturing & delivery process that lowers our carbon footprint, our eco-friendly ethos has been at the core of our brand from day one. enrich our lives with timeless, well-made furniture, but couldn’t find ones that didn’t break the bank. Read More Buy Online Furniture Store with Modern Designs Discover the Convenience of Shopping for Modern Furniture Online Our digital storefront is designed to make finding and purchasing contemporary designs a breeze. From chic, minimalist pieces to bold, statement-making selections, our online collection caters to diverse tastes and preferences. Embrace the future of furniture shopping by exploring our extensive range of high-quality, stylish options from the comfort of your home. What Types of Modern Furniture Does Castlery Sell? Castlery offers a wide array of good quality furniture to suit every room in your home. Our selection includes comfortable and stylish sofas , sleek dining tables and chairs and contemporary beds. For those looking for where to buy curated collections, Castlery’s furniture sets help you effortlessly furnish your home with style and cohesion. Our living room sets are designed to create a harmonious and inviting living space, these sets can include sofas, chairs, coffee tables, and side tables, all curated to complement each other perfectly. Our store also stocks outdoor pieces for creating your perfect exterior retreat, along with a variety of accent pieces and accessories to complete your interior design. Each piece is crafted with care, ensuring that it not only looks good but also stands the test of time. Frequently Asked Questions about Buying Modern Furniture What styles of contemporary furniture does Castlery offer? Castlery's range spans from mid-century modern to Scandinavian and minimalist designs. Our home furniture collection is thoughtfully curated to incorporate pieces that are both functional and aesthetically pleasing, ensuring they complement any interior design theme. Browse our collection now. Does Castlery offer free shipping? Absolutely. At Castlery, we're thrilled to offer free shipping on a selection of items and for orders that hit a specific value mark. Read our delivery policy for details and to discover if your order makes the cut for free delivery. It's all about adding more joy and less hassle to your shopping experience with us. Do you deliver to all states across the country? At Castlery, we're on a mission to bring our stylish and quality home furniture to doorsteps nationwide. While we strive to cover as many areas as possible, delivery availability can vary based on location. For most major cities across the country, we do offer delivery services, with shipping fees structured into flat rates depending on the value of the shipment and the delivery destination. Wondering if your home is within our reach? Simply zip over to any product page on our site, punch in your zip code – and you'll find all the details on delivery to your doorstep, including any applicable shipping fees based on your order's value and destination. It's our way of ensuring that no matter where you are, you're never too far from adding a touch of Castlery to your space. What is Castlery’s cancellation policy? We get it – sometimes plans take a turn. That's why our cancellation policy is designed with your flexibility in mind. Need to make a change or call off your order? No sweat, as long as you catch us before your shipment hits the road. We allow you to change or cancel your order without additional charges with a 24-hour grace period provided upon notification that your shipment is ready. After this period, cancellations incur a 20% restocking fee. Exceptions include items marked as 'Clearance', 'Final Sale', or display items, which cannot be canceled or refunded. Do you offer a warranty on your furniture? Castlery offers a range of warranty durations across its home furniture collection, ensuring quality and customer satisfaction. Starting with dining chairs, tables, TV cabinetry, sideboards, bookcases, and free-standing shelving, each comes with a 1-year warranty against manufacturing defects. Sofas are provided with longer protection, featuring a 3-year warranty. This structure demonstrates Castlery's commitment to durability and customer service, with varying warranty periods tailored to the nature and usage of each furniture category. Does Castlery offer assembly services? For Castlery products, assembly requirements can vary. To determine if a specific item requires assembly, you should check the Product Information section on its individual product page. If an item is not explicitly listed as 'Fully Assembled', it means that some level of assembly will be needed upon delivery. For products that do require assembly, Castlery provides a step-by-step guide. This guide is designed to facilitate an easy and hassle-free assembly process, ensuring that you can put your new furniture together with confidence and ease. What payment methods does Castlery accept? Castlery accepts several payment methods, including Visa, MasterCard, American Express, Diners Club, and Discover credit cards. Plus, we've partnered with Affirm to offer financing options, allowing for more flexible payment plans. All transactions are processed in USD, catering to a broad customer base and simplifying the purchase process of home furniture online. Where to buy modern furniture? The best place to buy modern furniture is right here at Castlery. Our online store offers a wide selection of contemporary furniture pieces designed to fit various lifestyles and preferences. Shop with us today to find the perfect additions to your home. Chip and Joanna Gaines Are Renovating a Historic Castle in Waco, Texas Search Subscribe Design Inspiration Room Ideas How to Renovate Lifestyle Entertaining Shopping Guides All News All Videos Newsletter Follow About Us Promotions Other Editions Your Privacy Choices Privacy Notice Terms Of Use Skip to Content Decorate Rooms Gardening Shopping Lifestyle Subscribe sign in Search 30+ Best Low-Light Plants 65 Bathroom Tile Designs Yard Landscaping Ideas 8 Best Latex Pillows Couches Under $500 Lifestyle Chip and Joanna Gaines Are Renovating a Historic Castle in Waco, Texas Chip and Joanna Gaines Are Renovating a Historic Castle in Waco, Texas Their new show, "Fixer Upper: Welcome Home - The Castle" documents the complete overhaul of this Central Texas landmark. By Claire Brito Published: Sep 30, 2022 6:18 PM EDT Save Article Design duo Chip and Joanna Gaines are taking on their biggest fixer yet: an over 100-year-old historic castle in Waco, Texas. Coming on Friday, October 14 to the Magnolia Network , Fixer Upper: Welcome Home - The Castle will feature six half-hour long episodes documenting the couple's total overhaul of a once-abandoned Central Texas estate. Dustin Cohen Known to Waco locals as Cottonland Castle, the stone structure dates back to 1913. "Chip and I have a long history of taking on unusual projects," Joanna writes in The Magnolia Journal , reminiscing on the first time her and her husband drove by the dilapidated structure in their hometown. "Yet, despite their various states of disrepair, to us these places tend to radiate a certain unexpected charm." Courtesy of Magnolia Network "The plan is to bring this beautiful property back to its original state," says Chip, who admits he'd been eying the purchase for two decades. But from efforts to preserve original elements like plaster and stonework to unexpected water leaks, the castle's overhaul turned out to be a much larger project than the couple anticipated. "Getting the same exact stone from 100 years ago has been a challenge," says Jo. Courtesy of Magnolia Network Tune in to see how the couple rose to the design challenge and unveil their biggest transformation yet. And, if you find yourself in the Waco area this fall, tickets are on sale for walking tours through the castle now through October 26 . So we created the furniture that fits your life: tables worthy of Sunday brunch that lasts all day, sofas perfect for HBO's latest true-crime documentary and beds made to snuggle up with the little ones. We take the responsibility of furnishing your home to heart and ensure that each piece earns its place for incredible design, impeccable quality, and durability that lasts. POLY & BARK Leather Furniture What makes our products unique? The New American Standard Our collections mirror the best of America. Globally inspired by a melting pot of cultures, and honing in on a long-standing tradition of expert craftsmen, our design team carefully constructs updated takes on iconic furniture and much-loved classics. How do you balance creativity and functionality in your designs? Each Poly & Bark product is thoughtfully designed for comfort, durability, and stunning aesthetics. From design to delivery, we pay careful attention every step of the way, ensuring your new furniture is picture-perfect. More POLY & BARK Products Tailored to Your Budget The glory of being an entirely online company means we have eliminated the enormous costs of maintaining brick and mortar showrooms and the markup of needless middle men. We are pleased to pass on those savings on to you, giving access to the most gorgeous pieces, less than traditional retailers. What problem are we solving? We understand the importance of shopping around and visualizing your space before making a decision. We've made buying furniture online stress-free. To calculate the overall star rating and percentage breakdown by star, we don’t use a simple average. Instead, our system considers things like how recent a review is and if the reviewer bought the item on Amazon. It also analyzed reviews to verify trustworthiness. Read more View Image Gallery Amazon Customer 5.0 out of 5 stars Images in this review Reviews with images See all photos Previous page Next page All photos Amazon Customer 5 out of 5 stars Small and comfy I probably looked at Poly and Bark items for the last few years. I’m always hesitant about buying seating furniture from Amazon because of all the variables. The chair was on sale and was soooo much cheaper than what I was seeing at Cb2, West Elm, Marshall’s, etc. So I thought I’d give it a try. 100% a smaller chair, which for me works because of my space. Someone mentioned it may not be a comfy fit for larger individuals, but as a 5’6-person, I feel like this chair was made for me lol. Anyway, comfy and the leather is beautiful. I’ll post an updated review if anything happens or a quality issue comes up :). Feels really sturdy as well. I’m a bit on the thicker side… I don’t feel like the chair is compromised because of this, so I’m very pleased with this purchase. The cushions are also padded quite well. AmeriAussie 5.0 out of 5 stars Fabulous - I'd give it 10 stars if I could Reviewed in the United States on September 8, 2024 Style: Verity Lounge Chair Size: Single Color: Cognac Tan Verified Purchase I cannot rate this chair highly enough. It is beautiful. The leather is stunning - and it's full leather on the back piece on both sides so it can be flipped if needed. The wood is gorgeous too. This feels like a $1200 chair to me.  It's deep and solid so my 6' 4" 250 lbs nephew sits comfortably. It's sits a bit lower than your average aide chair but that's the style it's intended to be. And best part - it comes fully assembled in the most amazing  packaging. All you have to do is slide it out of the box. If I could, I'd give it 10 stars. Reviewed in the United States on September 4, 2024 Style: Verity Lounge Chair Size: Single Color: Cognac Tan Verified Purchase I agonized quite a bit over the kind of chair that I would purchase to go with my leather sectional of a similar color. A lot of the styles that I found just didn't match my aesthetic, but once I found THIS one, I was in love. The leather is soft and the curvature of the armrests is perfect. The bottom cushion has straps to attach it to the frame. The top cushion is not attached, but it doesn't slide when you sit in it.  My husband is 6 feet tall and I am 5 feet tall and we both find it comfortable. I've spent more time in this chair in the first couple of weeks that I've owned it than I spent in my previous chair that I had owned for years. I highly recommend this chair. Our Best Sellers Visit the Store See What's New Visit the Store Next page From the manufacturer Durable legs easily adjust in two-inch increments to give you height options between 39.75 and 45 inches. Choose to mount your headboard on the wall with the wall mounts to give you even more height options. Conveniently ships to your door in a single box with all the parts required for basic assembly so you can quickly enjoy your headboard. All necessary hardware for easy assembly, wall mounts, and optional modification plates are included in a compartment on the back of the headboard. Product Description Get ready to update your Full bed frame with an old time classic. The Edenbrook Miller Headboard is a modern take on classic, Mid-Century Modern design with its gently rounded edges, tufted border, and stitched details that are sure to stun. Upholstered in a performance velvet available in six colors, this headboard will upgrade your Full bed set so you can rest in style. And there's no need to worry about whether or not this is tall enough to be your Full bed headboard. The headboard adjusts in two-inch increments, or you can take the legs off and use it as a wall mounted headboard to ensure it fits your space. We also provide all the parts you need in a pocket on the back of the headboard so you can quickly assemble your headboard and get your bed looking beautiful in no time. To give you further peace of mind, this headboard is TSCA compliant and made of durable materials so you can enjoy it for years to come. Add the Edenbrook Miller Headboard to your bedroom furniture for an instant fashion statement. WARNING: CHOKING HAZARD -- Small parts. Not for children under 3 yrs. To calculate the overall star rating and percentage breakdown by star, we don’t use a simple average. Instead, our system considers things like how recent a review is and if the reviewer bought the item on Amazon. It also analyzed reviews to verify trustworthiness. Read more View Image Gallery Amazon Customer 5.0 out of 5 stars Images in this review Reviews with images See all photos Previous page Next page All photos Amazon Customer 4 out of 5 stars Solid Quality Headboard That Gets the Job Done Great quality headboard with clean minimal aesthetics. Easy to assemble. I bought a Queen size headboard and find the material of the headboard to be lovely. It came earlier than expected and everything in the box was well organized and labeled. The main legs are in the back of the headboard which you just lift the velcro strap cover and pull the legs out. The legs were shorter than I expected and would not feel as sturdy if I only used the top screw by itself to get maximum height so I used the top two holes and the height still worked out in the end. The bed I have with the foundation is generally taller and thicker than most regular beds so it worked out. The color I got was the gray but it was more of like a cream color which is what I was going for. I did not actually screw the headboard legs into my metal bed frame but the additional modifier tools provided would have worked but I was just too lazy to do it. Instead, I have the bed pushed against the headboard into the wall which just as well with no shaking at all. Overall, it is a solid product and I will likely buy another one for my guest bedroom. Jamie 5.0 out of 5 stars SLEEPING LIKE A QUEEN Reviewed in the United States on April 30, 2024 Size: Queen Color: Black Verified Purchase Just got the Low Profile Velvet Headboard for my queen size bed and I'm loving it! Here's why it's earned five stars from me: 💎 Luxurious Design: This headboard's velvet material adds a touch of luxury to my bedroom. It's like having a fancy hotel vibe right at home! 🛏 Low Profile, High Style: I'm all about that sleek, minimalist look, and this headboard nails it! It's not too flashy, but it definitely brings the "wow" factor. 💤 Comfort Galore: With its padded design, this headboard is perfect for lounging in bed with a book or binge-watching my favorite shows. It's like having a plush pillow for my back! 🔧 Easy Peasy Installation: Setting it up was a breeze! The instructions were crystal clear, and all the necessary hardware was included. No headaches, just pure satisfaction. 💪 Built to Last: Despite its soft exterior, this headboard feels rock-solid. It's sturdy enough to withstand all my late-night Netflix marathons and then some. Overall, if you're looking to add a little pizzazz to your bedroom, the Low Profile Velvet Headboard is a winner! It's stylish, comfy, and makes me feel like a million bucks every time I walk into my room. 🌟🛌✨ Read more 5 people found this helpful Helpful Report MaRo 5.0 out of 5 stars Happy customer! Easy to assemble. I bought a Queen size headboard and find the material of the headboard to be lovely. It came earlier than expected and everything in the box was well organized and labeled. The main legs are in the back of the headboard which you just lift the velcro strap cover and pull the legs out. The legs were shorter than I expected and would not feel as sturdy if I only used the top screw by itself to get maximum height so I used the top two holes and the height still worked out in the end. The bed I have with the foundation is generally taller and thicker than most regular beds so it worked out. The color I got was the gray but it was more of like a cream color which is what I was going for. I did not actually screw the headboard legs into my metal bed frame but the additional modifier tools provided would have worked but I was just too lazy to do it. Instead, I have the bed pushed against the headboard into the wall which just as well with no shaking at all. Overall, it is a solid product and I will likely buy another one for my guest bedroom. Product Description Whether you’re into art-deco design, Japandi interiors, or a modern motif, this is the TV stand you’ve been looking for. With its sleek and subtle hardware, reeded double doors, and fuss-free open storage cubby, your tech will be perfectly perched in style. Its low profile leaves room for you to display your wall-mounted TV, décor, or wall art, yet it offers enough open and closed storage for all your entertainment center essentials. A warp-resistant MDF wood build and stunning yet durable laminate finish lend form, function, and a fashionable aesthetic. To calculate the overall star rating and percentage breakdown by star, we don’t use a simple average. Instead, our system considers things like how recent a review is and if the reviewer bought the item on Amazon. It also analyzed reviews to verify trustworthiness. All the components arrived intact and undamaged.  It took some time to put together, but there were no surprises and the instructions were easy to understand. Sarver 4.0 out of 5 stars Easy to assemble Reviewed in the United States on September 25, 2024 Color: Coastal Oak Size: 58 Inch Verified Purchase Very easy assemble, although there is a lot of screws which may look scary at first, the manual shows the 20 steps and you can build it by yourself quickly, until you get to hanging the doors, which is a lot of easier with another person holding the door. It is smaller than I thought, I wanted it this low but I thought it was a bit wider, it looks nice and looks more expensive than it is but be careful removing the part stickers as it may peel the finish with it! Also make sure you put glue in the quarter turn inserts as they easily unscrew. Read more Helpful Report Maddi 5.0 out of 5 stars Looks great but the quality is questionable. Style 10/10 Build 8/10 wood quality 5/10 Reviewed in the United States on March 20, 2024 Color: Mocha Size: 58 Inch Verified Purchase I've been looking for a new TV stand for my bedroom but needed it to be an MCM style to match our apartment decor. I almost bought a black metal one then saw this under the recommended (never saw it before) but needed it. Overall, it is beautiful and looks super nice, The build time took me around 40 minutes alone, I worked at IKEA for 5 years, so this crap does not faze me but others yes...it's all in small parts and a million little screws and glue. Just go slow. I do have one major flaw with it and it's that the wood is SO FRAGILE, I was building it and noticed that the bottom part already had a scratch in the wood which can be seen in some of the photos. (You get what you pay for) I'm okay with this as...some colored pencils will do wonders. Overall I love it, the build time was fine and the style is immaculate. But note that this stand is SHORT. For reference, I've added a photo of my men's size 12 Converse. not much taller than the shoe. But my room is already MCM style so most of my furniture is low to the ground and from the bed it's perfect. 55-60inch TV on the smaller 40'' stand. Good luck! Images in this review Helpful Report J Lisbon 1.0 out of 5 stars Disappointing Assembly and Return Experience Reviewed in the United States on September 1, 2024 Color: Mocha Size: 70 Inch Verified Purchase My experience was disappointing. Assembly is not easy and takes time, with so many screws to tighten that I ended up with blisters on my hands. After nearly an hour of work, I encountered a major issue at step 14: the pre-drilled holes for the base were only 1 mm deep, while the screws were 20 mm long. This manufacturing defect made it impossible to complete the assembly. While I could have drilled the holes myself, I didn't have a drill. When I called customer support, I was initially told I could dispose of the item and receive a refund. However, after noticing the refund hadn't been processed, I contacted them again and was informed that the product needed to be picked up instead. Since the instructions required gluing parts together, the unit cannot be disassembled for a normal return. The alternative pick-up process was quite bureaucratic, requiring me to fill out a lengthy form with over 10 fields of product information, such as weight, size, and order number—information that Amazon should already have. In total, I spent almost 6 hours dealing with this, and the pick-up was scheduled for 7 days later, leaving me with an unfinished and unusable piece of furniture taking up valuable space in my living room for a week. While other customers may have had better luck, this experience was frustrating for me. If you choose to buy this product, be aware that you may encounter significant challenges during assembly and potential complications if a return is needed. Read more 4 people found this helpful Helpful Report Rose 5.0 out of 5 stars Perfect tv stand Reviewed in the United States on September 20, 2024 Color: Coastal Oak Size: 58 Inch Verified Purchase It was easy to put together on my own! Looks good with my 55inch tv, very happy with my purchase. By Marina Liao Published: Nov 17, 2023 Save Article Whether you're working on a home reno project right now and need inspiration, or just want interior design eye candy , House Beautiful 's sixth annual Whole Home will provide all that and more. We worked with 13 woman-led design teams to renovate a 13,000-square-foot David Adler estate in Hinsdale, Illinois and the fruits of everyone's labor has finally been unveiled. You can actually take a virtual 3D tour of the home to get an in-depth view of every room, which is decked out with the most luxe and gorgeous furniture and decor pieces. Beware: As you wander through the space, you may get lost or walk around in circles—the property is massive! As you take a look around, you may even be tempted to shop the items you see. For fans of Serena & Lily especially, you'll be pleased to know that many of the rooms in the home feature products from the beloved brand. Take the entryway , which shows off the label's Driftway bookshelf and Driftway dresser . Wander around a bit more and you'll come across one of the many bedrooms that feature its coastal-inspired furniture and bedding from the brand. For those who are feeling inspired by the estate and want to purchase the exact Serena & Lily items seen in the house, you're in luck. We rounded up several of our favorite furniture pieces you can shop right now. Many of the items are also on sale (and ship for free!) thanks to Serena & Lily's Sale of the Year shopping extravaganza, which ends on November 29. Take advantage of all the deals right now and add your favorite Serena & Lily furniture to cart. Ahead, find an easy-to-digest list of items we have our eyes on, as seen in Whole Home .
